message:
Do you feel comfortable and safe to express yourself at work? 

Last week, the European Court of Justice ruled that employers can prohibit their workers from displaying political, philosophical or religious beliefs, if they feel it is necessary for employees to present themselves neutrally towards clients.

Muslim women who chose to wear a hijab are disproportionally affected by this ruling. The ECJ ruling reinforces the stigma around headscarves and feeds into beliefs about religious inequalities.

We believe in a Europe where everyone should have equal rights and opportunities. Inequality and discrimination based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, or skin colour are unacceptable!

-

#socialequality #antiracism #socialjustice #europeancourtofjustice #europeanpolitics #eu #religion #selfexpression #myhijabmychoice #hijab

If we have learned one thing from COVID, it is that we need to reform European healthcare systems.

Health facility organisations should not be completely run by centralised bureaucratic agencies. They need to be independent and empowered to deliver the highest quality of care with minimal involvement of governments, politicians and bureaucrats in operational decisions. 

ğŸ‘‰ Medical professionals, with patient co-participation, should be empowered to make operational decisions; 
ğŸ‘‰ State(s) should provide the necessary conditions for healthcare and insurance providers to function to a high standard; 
ğŸ‘‰ States should set in place the legal and regulatory framework for healthcare financing to result in adequate universal coverage with affordable health care for all.

Given the multitude of healthcare systems across the continent, Volt is convinced that the optimal public-private coordination and division of tasks needs to be determined on a country-by-country and case-by-case basis.

If you want to know more about our plans for European healthcare, stay tuned for more content shortly!

-

#Europeanhealth #healthcare #europeanhealthcare #covid19 #socialsecurity #coverage #socialcoverage

On Friday 15th July, the @europeancommission launched Infringement Procedures against Hungary and Poland for violating the fundamental rights of LGBTQ+ people. 

These countries now have 2ï¸âƒ£ months to send a response. 

If the Commission then decides that EU law has not been respected, then they will send a formal request to comply with EU law. If the member states do not take remedial measures, the Commission will refer them to the Court of Justice, who may impose penalties. 

But how have Poland and Hungary breached EU law?

ğŸ‘‰ Hungary has just banned LGBTQ+ content to â€œprotect minors''. Homosexuality can no longer be referred to in schools and further restrictions on LGBTQ+ adverts have been adopted.
ğŸ‘‰ Around 100 towns and cities in Poland defined themselves as â€œfree of LGBT ideologyâ€. 

We support the procedure started by the European Commission and urge both national governments to rectify and give back these basic human rights that should have never been taken away.

âš ï¸ Attacks upon EU fundamental rights have to stop âš ï¸ 

-

#LGBTQIRights #InVarietateConcordia #TogetherStronger #JoinTheChange #VoteVolt

Heb jij interesse in de Nederlandse en de Europese politiek? Wil je een steentje bijdragen aan een progressieve agenda? En kun jij als geen ander netwerken en mensen verbinden? Dan heb je geluk! Volt is namelijk op zoek naar talent scouts! Na een periode van ongekende groei zijn wij, met o.a. een blik op de aankomende gemeenteraadsverkiezingen, op zoek naar talent scouts die de juiste mensen op de juiste plek weten te plaatsen. Als echte matchmaker ben je onmisbaar in dit proces en zorg je ervoor dat Volt goed voorbereid is om de uitdagingen van de 21e eeuw aan te pakken!Â 

Wat ga je doen?
âš¡ï¸ Actief mensen benaderen met de vraag of zij interesse hebben om politiek actief te wordenâ€¨âš¡ï¸ Met lokale teams in gesprek om te onderzoeken welke talenten zij hebben in hun team, wie zij graag willen benaderen en dat namens hen te doenâ€¨âš¡ï¸ Contacten leggen om potentieel talent te scoutenâ€¨
Geschatte tijdsbesteding:
Ongeveer 4 - 6 uur per week

Herken jij jezelf hierin? Ben je enthousiast geworden? Neem dan contact op met Anna Strolenberg en mail naar anna.strolenberg@volteuropa.org

Volt hecht groot belang aan inclusiviteit en verwelkomt daarom graag sollicitaties van mensen die de diversiteit van het team kunnen versterken.

Het kabinet had vorig jaar een regionale aanpak klaarliggen om coronabrandhaarden al vroeg de kop in te drukken. Maar dit plan werd niet gebruikt en er kwam een derde golf.

Laten we daar dit jaar van leren en wÃ©l een regionale aanpak kiezen, om een vierde golf te voorkomen.

Een Kamermeerderheid stemde voor ons voorstel om deze regionale corona-aanpak te actualiseren. En het kabinet zegde toe hiermee aan de slag te gaan.

The world is in the midst of a climate crisis, and what we need are no more empty promises but concrete plans for action.
 
Sustainable public transport holds great potential for reducing emissions of greenhouse gases at the local level. Hence we want to support all measures and initiatives encouraging sustainable means of transportation. This includes
 
ğŸ‘‰  Extending the ban on diesel cars by 2040 across Europe
 
ğŸ‘‰  Modernizing the transportation systems in Europe both for short and long distances
 
ğŸ‘‰  Establishing relevant infrastructure in cities such as creating bicycle-friendly zones and bike lanes, promoting sharing solutions, introducing free public parking slots for electric cars
 
If you want to learn more about our plans for addressing the climate crisis, stay tuned for more content shortly!

As #European citizens we currently do not have a European #vote ! You can only vote for your national politicians to go to the European #parliament . 27 national rules determine whom you can vote for and how your vote translates into political action.
 
#together we can call for changes that gives a voice to all Europeans! â€˜I Vote Europeâ€™ pushes for truly European elections giving you a European vote to create positive change.

42 years ago today, Simone Veil became the first woman to be directly elected President of the European Parliament.

After surviving the death camps, she left her mark on Europe advocating for gender equality and fighting discrimination against women. Her commitment to women's rights advanced French laws by legalising the right to abortion.

However, her life's work is not over. Women's rights are still being questioned in Europe; we must fight to keep her legacy alive and further the cause for equality! 

Join us now to move forward together for women's rights in Europe! â™€ï¸ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º
.

The European Council adopted a Directive that temporarily grants â€œbuy and doneâ€ VAT exemptions, in light of the negative effects of the COVID pandemic. The main goal of this Directive is to enable the Commission and other EU agencies to purchase products and services to provide them free of charge. 

But, what is an EU Directive?

ğŸ”It is a legislative act that sets out an EU goal that the Member States must achieve, but each one can design how to accomplish them (it leaves room for tailor-made policies).

What are the main takeaways from this Directive?

ğŸ‘‰ Purchases made by an EU authority on behalf of Member States to respond to the COVID-19 pandemic are temporarily VAT-free. It allows for more donations across EU countries.

ğŸ‘‰ It is Retroactive. Although adopted on 13 July 2021, the date of entry into force was January 2021. The Member States have until 31 December 2021 to comply with this Directive. 

We celebrate this measure since it ensures the allocation of EU funds to fight the devastating effects of the COVID pandemic.

1,146 people died on the dangerous migration sea routes to Europe between January and June. This is more than double the number of people compared to the same period last year.

Meanwhile, Frontex, the EU border agency, is coming under criticism and has been accused of neglect, mismanagement and even migrant pushback by the @europeanparliament and @humanrightswatch.

It is time to reform the EU refugee system, as we simply cannot accept such abuses and the loss of human lives at our borders any longer. We need a common EU refugee policy, to reform the Dublin Regulation, and to increase legal pathways into Europe.

One Union to inspire them all, One Union to protect them, One Union to support them all and in the Rule of Law, unite them. But what exactly is the European Parliament?

The European Parliament is together with the Council of Ministers the legislative branch of the European Union. It has the responsibility to prepare laws and approve the Unionâ€™s budget.

The Parliament is the only directly elected institution of the European Union and consists of 705 members, in which seats are allocated according to a member state population size. Representation is limited to max. 96 seats and min 6 seats per state. We believe that the EU institutions must be reformed for better transparency, efficiency, and democracy. For that we must:

ğŸ‘‰ Harmonise the adoption of EU legislation. 
ğŸ‘‰ Submit European legislation to the Parliament and Council for it to become law when approved by both.
ğŸ‘‰ Create a dedicated mechanism to deal with lingering disagreements between the two houses.
ğŸ‘‰ Give the parliament the final say, as it is the more direct representative body.
ğŸ‘‰ Reform the election of the European Parliament. The current â€œdegressive proportionalityâ€ negates the core principle of â€œone person, one voteâ€ which ensures equal say for all citizens in the political system. Volt therefore proposes a voting system that enshrines this principle and combines the election of representatives at the lowest level possible with the proportional representation of political parties in Parliament.

Fun fact: Although the European parliament was constructed in 1952, the parliament members were directly elected in 1979 and after the Lisbon treaty in 2009, given equal legislative power to the Council.

In aflevering twee luister je naar een warm gesprek met Azadeh Achbari. In aflevering drie is Fre Hooft van Huysduynen te gast bij Victor. Fre is founder van soulservice.org en gaat met Victor op zoek naar de fundamenten van de nieuwe bestuurscultuur die we zo hard nodig hebben en over het vele wat vrouwen daarbij in te brengen hebben.

It is deeply disturbing that several authoritarian governments hacked into the phones of thousands to crush dissent, silence journalists and politicians and attack activists and business executives.

Not only does this undermine the rule of law, personal rights and press freedom but it also undermines the very basis of our democracy.

This investigation should also serve as a reminder that digital innovations can be misused by people with wrong intentions. If our governments want to strengthen freedom of opinion and the rule of law, they should make it their priority to increase public fundings for research and invest more massively in cybersecurity.

Because we cannot and should not live in a World where our personal rights and freedom of opinion can be threatened through our own smartphones. 
.

Summertime is travel time so let's focus on the road, to bring you somewhere beautiful!

Travelling in 2021 is quite the challenge, with all countries regularly updating their entry rules and requirements. We have all been wondering: do I need a PCR, do I need to quarantine, are my vaccines acceptedâ€¦? And other such fun questions! Re-open EU is a European initiative showing all the restrictions and rules in all EU countries, proving that centralised coordination for the  sanitary pass for vaccines and PCR tests has great benefits for citizens. 

Giving more power to the EU in regulating health programmes would be a great way to centralise decision-making and have more coherent health policies across Europe. Say goodbye to the french travel certificate to go to the supermarket or the Cypriot requirements to wear a mask between bites of your meal.  For that we want to:

ğŸ‘‰ Give additional health competencies to the EU

ğŸ‘‰ Improved coordination between all Member States

Samen met een groep Volters liep @laurens.dassen gisteren mee met de Pride Walk in Amsterdam. Wij liepen natuurlijk niet zomaar mee. Het wordt tijd dat Nederland meer gaat doen voor de gelijkheid van LHBTI+-ers. Een meerderheid durft namelijk nog steeds niet hand in hand op straat te lopen.

Wat ons betreft is de tijd van symboliek voorbij en is het tijd om Pride om te zetten in beleid. Er moeten extra stappen worden gezet om discriminatie tegen te gaan, om acceptatie in het onderwijs te bevorderen en om de rechtspositie van LHBTI+-ers in de Nederlandse wetgeving te verbeteren. Daarbij kunnen wij veel leren van onze Europese partners. Met name Malta, BelgiÃ« en Luxemburg zijn koplopers op het gebied van LHBTI+-emancipatie. Nederland zou wat ons betreft ook weer koploper hierin moeten worden.

Ook willen wij graag aandacht vragen voor een petitie die oproept om de positie van LHBTI-vluchtelingen tegenover de IND te verbeteren. Nog te vaak worden zij beoordeeld vanuit een westers perspectief. Voor hen moet het makkelijker worden om een veilig thuis in Nederland te vinden. De link staat in onze bio!

One Union to inspire them all, One Union to protect them, One Union to support them all and in the Rule of Law, unite them. But what exactly is the European Court of Justice?

Since 1952, the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU) sits in Luxembourg and acts as the ultimate guardian of EU law, making sure it is correctly interpreted and enforced by national and EU institutions. All member states are equally represented there, as each nominates three of its rotating judges.

Voltâ€™s vision for the ECJ is to expand its powers and bring it closer to citizens by: 

ğŸ‘‰ Empowering it to settle disputes among member states; 
ğŸ‘‰ Allowing it to sanction Member States more effectively;
ğŸ‘‰ Opening regional branches.

Find out more about volt policies on our website! (link in the bio)

Fun fact: The CJEU is often mistaken for the European Court of Human Rights, which is part of the European Council, and not part of the EU.

If we have learnt one thing from COVID, it is that we need to reform European healthcare systems.

If we want to align EU healthcare systems, we first introduce further harmonisation of prescriptions and use of medicine across countries. 

European Medical Agency (EMA) could fulfill such a role and ensure a better conformity between Member States prescriptions laws. 

For instance, a first priority is to reduce the large inter-country variation in antibiotic consumption, as overuse of antibiotics is increasingly leading to pathogen resistance.

The world is in the midst of a climate crisis, and what we need are no more empty promises but concrete plans for action.

We exploit the environment to create items with a short lifetime that soon will go to waste. This is how our current economic model works, and it is absolutely unsustainable. 

It is unfair to those who are affected by inhumane working conditions or poisoned living areas. It is also unfair to future generations, who will not be able to use the resources that we are wasting. Let's work to change this by moving toward a circular economy! We need to:

ğŸ‘‰ Ensure fair-trade and foster efficient use and recycling of critical raw materials;

ğŸ‘‰ Advocate for the implementation of harmonised circular economy solutions across Europe;

ğŸ‘‰ Take concerted action to move away from a plastic-based society.

If you want to learn more about our plans for addressing the climate crisis, stay tuned for more content shortly!

De verschrikkelijke gebeurtenissen in Afghanistan - de snelle verovering van het land door de Taliban, de problemen met de evacuatie van Europese en Afghaanse burgers, de rellen tegen Afghanen die hier naartoe vluchten om een veilig bestaan proberen op te bouwen - laat ons niet in de koude kleren zitten. Daarom roepen wij iedereen op om te komen demonstreren op de Dam: morgen, zaterdag 28 augustus om 15:00. 

Het is inhumaan dat mensen die vrezen voor hun leven niet met open armen verwelkomd worden en het is inhumaan dat niet alle mensen die hier horen te zijn, hier ook echt zijn. 
Wij laten zien dat wij geven om de slachtoffers, hun nabestaanden, de inwoners van Afghanistan, de Afghaanse medewerkers die ons daar ter plaatse hebben bijgestaan, vrouwen, mensenrechtenactivisten, journalisten en andere kwetsbare groepen. We hopen met velen aanwezig te zijn, zodat we kunnen laten zien dat wij de Afghaanse bevolking steunen, dat wij Afghaanse vluchtelingen die hier naartoe komen willen verwelkomen en dat wij opkomen voor mensenrechten en vrijheid; EU-breed en wereldwijd. 
Wil je je aansluiten bij de groep Volters die gaat?

Meld je aan via het formulier in onze bio.

Volt Europa demands to evacuate local forces and vulnerable people from Afghanistan now!

The situation in Afghanistan is dramatic and deteriorating rapidly. In the past few days, the Taliban have captured all major cities and they are now controlling large parts of the country. After months of failing to bring local people to safety, the federal government has recently announced its intention to evacuate people quickly. However, many who have worked for NGOs, the media and/or Western governments are incurring greater risk of being left behind. 

Today, we are leaving vulnerable people (activists, journalists, etc.) to death and torture. Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has promised to take in 20k vulnerable Afghans, and Europe has a duty to follow suit.

We call on all European governments to jointly evacuate local staff of NGOs, ministries, foundations, armed forces, media, etc. as well as their families - without restrictions. It is equally important that Europe accepts people in need of protection and grants more DAAD scholarships to students and academics from Afghanistan in the short term. 

Time is running out: unilateralism, bureaucracy, egoism and electoral considerations are costing human lives. 

Today, only one thing matters: acting in the interest of the people in Afghanistan!

 #SolidarityWithAfghanistan

Matt Bristow is both a Berliner and British, but most of all, heâ€™s a passionate European. Last spring, his local Volt team in Pankow selected him as candidate for the 26 September local elections. But the Berlin Electoral Commission rejected his candidacy.

Why? After Brexit, @matt_bristow no longer holds the citizenship of an EU member state and therefore, he was told he is no longer a EU citizen. We disagree with this argument. 

EU citizenship is not subordinate to the nationality of an EU member state. Once you have rights as an EU citizen, these cannot be simply taken away by a national government.

But what does EU citizenship mean exactly? The Maastricht Treaty created a new form of legal citizenship for our common European identity: EU Citizenship. So all citizens of an EU member state automatically became dual citizens overnight: in addition to national citizenship, they now had EU citizenship and its rights (including the right to vote or be a candidate in local elections).

However, the EU Treaties do not mention how or when EU citizenship can be lost. But it is clear that national governments cannot simply take away EU citizenship from entire groups of people. This is an individual status that cannot be removed by elections or governments without due process.

We support Mattâ€™s constitutional appeal so that he can be on the electoral list. By doing so, we are fighting for EU citizenship as the fundamental status of all Europeans, wherever they may live and whichever nationality they might hold.

#GenerationEuropa #EUcitizenship #ECJ #futuremadeineurope #citizenship @volt_berlin

If we have learnt one thing from COVID, it is that we need to reform European healthcare systems.

Throughout Europe, lifestyle choices are major contributors to the total burden of disease. Unhealthy lifestyle choices such as physical inactivity and poor diet are leading risk factors for ill-health, which can result in (chronic) conditions such as cancer, obesity, diabetes, cardiovascular disease and premature death.

A preventive lifestyle for both physical and mental/social well-being should be a focus in schools, companies, and in public awareness campaigns. Regardless of socioeconomic position, all European residents should have access to first-rate preventive healthcare over the entire life-cycle. 

Explore and test tax reforms for a healthier diet, will include:

ğŸ‘‰ Increases in VAT on unhealthy foods including saturated fats, trans-fatty acids, and processed sugars;

ğŸ‘‰ Decreases in VAT on healthy vegetables and fruits.

If you want to know more about our plans for European healthcare, stay tuned for more content shortly!

If we have learnt one thing from COVID, it is that we need to reform European healthcare systems.

For a more sustainable healthcare, we want to work towards controlled decriminalisation or legalisation of drugs.

Portugal's progressive legislation and attitude towards drug addiction has shown that the current predominant model of a â€œwar on drugsâ€ has not and will not work.

Volt intends to emulate Portugal's model and decriminalise all drug possession under a certain threshold. This will free up police resources to follow up on large scale drug smuggling and buyer victimisation.

It will enable European societies to treat addiction as a medical and not a criminal problem.

Not all those who wander are lost, mobility is part of EU identity!

Biking is fun and it is also a great workout for wanna-be Tour-de-France competitors. More importantly, biking infrastructures have a great impact on local air quality,  physical and mental health. Decent cycling infrastructures encourage more and more people to take a bike instead of drive, especially on short trips.

It takes quite a long time to develop good infrastructures so thereâ€™s no time to waste. Local councils need to get started now and work on plans to develop cycle-friendly traffic solutions. 

For your next local election, make sure to #voteVolt for cycle-friendly cities!

Not all those who wander are lost, mobility is part of EU identity!

If you are travelling in Europe, chances are you will be taking a plane if you have no other transport options. Flying is often faster and cheaper than other modes of transportation but the environmental costs are very high!

To meet the #climategoals of the European Green Deal, Europe needs to update its aviation management. For a more climate-conscious aviation sector, we want to:

ğŸ‘‰ Abolish taxation exemptions on aircraft fuel. 

ğŸ‘‰ Increase efforts to achieve net-zero emissions in European international and domestic aviation by 2040 through the aviation advisory council.

ğŸ‘‰ Increase funding for green aviation to go beyond current concepts with limited potential based on evolutionary designs and aim at revolutionary concepts. 

ğŸ‘‰ Push for R&D programs on sustainable aircraft and infrastructure emission reduction.
 
Are you curious about alternatives to flying? Keep an eye out for our next #tMobilitySeries posts!

Yesterday @ursula_vonderleyen talked about past achievements and presenting plans for the upcoming years in the #SOTEU.

âœ… Ambitious plans for #Digitalisation and foreign and development policies

âŒ Migration, EU reforms, democracy, climate lacked concrete action plans.

#TechSovereignty âœ… - The chips act is great news for industries. Not only will it create jobs in a booming industry, but it will also avoid shortages in assembly lines. Tech sovereignty is capital if we want to digitalise Europe. â—ï¸ We will need unified actions to be competitive.

#Youth âŒ - â€œ2022 will be the year of youth!â€ We cannot endorse such hazy statements. Young people suffered enormously during the pandemic with reduced access to university and very low employment rates. We need real and concrete solutions.

#Domesticviolence âœ… - Domestic violence and #violence against women is central to the EU. A new act to bring perpetrators to justice more systematically is in the pipelines. We will be waiting for more concrete explanations although, great news that more actions are taken.

#EUReforms âŒ - The #SOTEU failed to mention EU reforms. The EU needs to evolve, we need to change the way we work, vote, participate and cooperate. We must reform EU governance and institutions if we want to reach our goals and further European integration.

#EndForcedLabour âœ… - The ban on products made by #ForcedLabour is great news. This means that companies wonâ€™t be able to make a profit on #Uyghurs labour or on slavery. These measures come decades too late, although, we are glad it will not be in the future.

#Migration âŒ - We need concrete solutions to support migrants because the situation in the camps in several EU countries is far from humane. The New Pact on #Migration and #Asylum is clearly not the only solution. We must talk about it and work on resettlement policies.

#ALMA âœ…- The #ALMA programme promotes inclusivity and equality in education. It gives young people who donâ€™t have access to education, jobs or training an opportunity to access work experience in a member state.

If you want to see our full reaction to the speech, check out our website. (link in the bio)

What do you call a moment where unconnected people all reach the same conclusion?

This is a stand alone complex, a theme addressed in my favorite show: Ghost in the Shell (not to be confused with the movies). Whenever I get the chance to watch the show again, Iâ€™m in awe at how it manages to capture the essence of a completely digitized society in all its raw beauty and the weirdness that stems from it. 

For example, have you ever wondered why conspiracy theories spread so far and easily right now? Itâ€™s a topic that lies very close to my heart and I would really like to explore it further with you. Stay tuned for next week!

In the meantime though, drop a question in the comments!

My grandfather was a great cook.

As a young man he used to travel the world as a helmsman on oil tankers. One of the things he really enjoyed during his travels were the different kinds of food the cultures he visited had to offer. He brought many of these recipes home to cook for our family and eventually passed them on to my mother as well.

A few days ago we had one of his favorites: Bami Kwa (spellings may differ). My mom had been wanting to cook this dish for a while now and it was great to eat this earthy soup with my mom and grandma. Preparing this Indonesian noodle soup takes a lot of work and we love making it together.

#bamikuah #bamikwa #indonesianfood #familylife #familytime #familyphotography #familyphoto #familydinner

Het is donderdag, dat betekent dat we weer een vraag over de Duitse verkiezingen gaan beantwoorden! De vraag is: wat zijn onze standpunten in Duitsland?

De standpunten van Volt Duitsland lijken in zekere mate op die van Volt Nederland. Als Volt willen wij natuurlijk een soortgelijke boodschap overbrengen door heel Europa. De belangrijkste steekwoorden in het verkiezingsprogramma van Volt Duitsland zijn: Europees, democratisch, actief, klimaatneutraal, ondernemend, digitaal, onafhankelijk, solidariteit en inclusief. Al deze idealen zijn belangrijk voor de progressieve politiek die Volt ook in Duitsland wil doorvoeren.

Johann skriver:
Just been reading an article about age distribution of the voter population in the German elections tomorrow:
The age group 60plus represents 38% of those entitled to vote, the age group 18-29 only 14.4%. 

This explains, why German politics has been targeted primarily at the pensioner generation and everything has been done to make them happy.
The bill will be paid by the younger ones, even those below 18. But the current government just couldn't have cared less about them.

This also explains why all the candidates of the established parties seem to be competing for the most conservative, traditionalist and boring image.
Continuation, not change is the message.

Volt is active on the #ConferenceontheFutureofEurope! 

We need to change how Europeans vote! 

The way we vote for our European political representatives has not changed since 1979. But in the meantime, Europe has changed. Five new treaties have been agreed upon and 19 new countries have joined the EU since 1979. As a result of this outdated system, there is no single European election. Instead, there are 27 national elections in 27 Member States.

Any citizen movement or political grouping that is able to collect a representative amount of signatures from eligible voters from a quarter of member states of the European Union should be able to run on a common European list and be eligible for elections across all European Union. These should include minimum democratic standards for party and ballot registration to ensure fair and EU-wide comparable access to European politics.

Do you support this proposal? Endorse it and check out all our other proposals using the link in the bio!

If you agree, check out our campaign @ivoteurope !
.
.
.

Volt is active on the #ConferenceontheFutureofEurope! 

Every socio-political group requires a collective story, an imagined community to bind together its citizens in common cause and give it legitimacy. A shared perspective on the past is one of the crucial building blocks of such a dynamic.

Education remains a prerogative of the Member States, but wide gaps exist in both the quality of substance and length devoted to the origins of the foundation of the European Union and its rationales; the catastrophes of the 20th century, with 1945 and 1989 as key dates.

At the same time, heavy politicisation and mythification of historical truth in some Member States has reinforced diverging public perceptions and political narratives through contested historical interpretations.

We want to create a-political the EU and its Member States to create common standards on European History Textbooks in various levels of education across the EU27! Let's plant a tree of community amongst the building blocks of our common past.

Do you support this proposal? Endorse it and check out all our other proposals using the link in the bio!

Hoe vet zou het zijn als je je elektrische auto kan opladen in de tijd dat je een dieselauto vol zou tanken? En hoe mooi is het als de technologie die daarvoor nodig is dan ook nog mede bedacht is door studenten?

Naast inzetten op OV en fietsen kunnen elektrische autoâ€™s een belangrijke rol spelen in de energietransitie. We willen dat bedrijven de ruimte krijgen om te innoveren, want door innovatie kunnen we obstakels in de verduurzaming wegnemen: door bijvoorbeeld de oplaadtijd van elektrische autoâ€™s te verkorten zodat meer mensen voor duurzaam vervoer kiezen.

Woensdag was ik op bezoek bij InMotion, en hun doel is om dat al binnen een paar jaar mogelijk te maken. In 2023 moet het opladen van je auto nog maar vier minuten duren.

Wat ook mooi is: studenten spelen hier een actieve rol in. Zij denken met InMotion mee over deze nieuwe technologie. Sommigen van hen nemen verlof van hun studie om er een jaar te komen werken. Het bedrijf onderhoudt daarna contact met deze studenten, zodat ze kunnen blijven meedenken over de doorontwikkeling van de technologie. 

#innovatie #duurzaamheid

Op basisschool de Globetrotter in Rotterdam Zuid geven ze kinderen per week tien uur extra les. Ze leren bij over theater, filosofie en sport. Betrokken leraren zorgen daarmee voor een mooie leeromgeving. 

Ook in Rotterdam Zuid: de inspirerende huisartsenpraktijk MozaÃ¯ek. Naast normale behandelingen kijken ze hoe ze patiÃ«nten verder kunnen helpen, bv door financiÃ«le begeleiding te bieden. De artsen weten dat schulden bijvoorbeeld voor rugklachten kunnen zorgen. Voor het welzijn wordt daarom een veelheid aan activiteiten aangeboden; van yoga tot meditatiecursussen en juridische vragen tot hulp bij opvoeden.

Ik vind het prachtig om te zien hoe de Globetrotter en MozaÃ¯ek met concrete en vernieuwende oplossingen vooruitgang in de wijk realiseren. 

Het Nationaal Programma Rotterdam Zuid werkt samen met de gemeente, corporaties, zorginstellingen, schoolbesturen, bedrijfsleven en de politie om het opleidingsniveau, de arbeidsparticipatie en de woonkwaliteit in twintig jaar flink omhoog te brengen. Een stevig programma dat als voorbeeld dient voor andere steden.

Donderdag bezocht ik een aantal van deze initiatieven tijdens een werkbezoek. Ik denk dat we veel kunnen leren van de creativiteit en samenwerking: ik krijg er in ieder geval veel energie van!

Vrijdag was ik op bezoek in Eindhoven. Daar sprak ik met onderzoekers en ondernemers die zich bezighouden met onderwerpen als kunstmatige intelligentie, digitalisering en klimaatverandering. 

Wat mij opvalt is hoe goed zij zijn in het bedenken van oplossingen voor de uitdagingen waar we voor staan. Zo leerde ik over een innovatieve manier om CO2 uit de lucht te halen, en over een methode om stikstof op te vangen met folie.

Ik denk dat we hier in de politiek van moeten leren. Want hoe mooi zou het zijn om deze creativiteit en ondernemersgeest ook in de politiek terug te kunnen zien!

Fremtiden krÃ¦ver ny mobilitet
(English below)

Cyklistforbundet inviterede politikere ud at cykle pÃ¥ Frederiksberg - for at vise udfordringerne. 

Der er lommer pÃ¥ Frederiksberg med usikre trafikforhold, der skal forbedres, men grundlÃ¦ggende skal vi tale om fremtiden grÃ¸nne mobilitet og hvad vi gÃ¸r for at styrke den.

62% af borgere pÃ¥ Frederiksberg har ikke bil. Nogle bruger deres sjÃ¦ldent, men dem, der bruger den hyppigt er bekymrede for sammenhÃ¦ngskraften i deres hverdag - sÃ¦rligt hvis biler tvinges ud ad byen uden gode alternativer.

Heldigvis er folk klar pÃ¥ omstilling, hvis der er brugbare alternativer. Eksempelvis fjernparkering suppleret med bedre kollektiv transport og bedre muligheder for delebiler til en overkommelig pris.

Bilen kan alt - hente mÃ¦lk eller kÃ¸re dig til Italien. DÃ©n frihed skal diskuteres i lyset af udfasning af fossile brÃ¦ndsler og at elbiler ikke er billige nok endnu.

Elcykler og sÃ¦rlige elcykelstier kunne styrkes, ligesom bedre kollektiv transport og mere fleksible arbejdstider kunne lette morgenracet.

English version
The future requires a new mobility

Back in August, the Cyclists' Union invited politicians on a bike ride in #Frederiksberg to discuss.

There are pockets of unsafe traffic conditions in Frederiksberg that need to be improved. But fundamentally we need to talk about the green mobility of the future and what we are doing to strengthen it.

62% of citizens in Frederiksberg do not have a car. Those who use their car frequently are worried about the cohesion in their daily lives - especially if cars are forced out before sufficient alternatives exist.

Fortunately, people are ready to make the switch if there are viable alternatives.
These include remote parking with better public transport and affordable car-sharing options.

The car can do everything - from fetching milk to driving you to Italy. We need to discuss this freedom in light of phasing out fossil fuels.

So yes, these issues require heavy dialogue between citizens and decision-makers.

Today is the international Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women! ğŸ“…

An estimate of 1ï¸âƒ£ in 3ï¸âƒ£ women in Europe have experienced domestic violence. Research shows that fear, anger, shock and shame are the most common emotional reactions in incidents of violence, and that it causes these women to experience anxiety, difficulties in sleeping, a loss of self confidence and depression.

Violence against women includes physical violence like harassement, assault, rape or murder. But the psychological violence is often invisible to the surroundings and can be just as, or sometimes even more traumatizing. It is important to fight violent behaviour by carrying out more information and awareness, establish safe spaces for the victims and create structures for the social reintegration of victims of abuse.

Today at 21:00 CETâ° we will talk about this issue through a live stream on this channel, join us!! ğŸ™ŒğŸ¾

Sport is political! We call for a diplomatic boycott of the 2022 Winter Olympics in China and the World Cup in Qatar. ğŸ™…â€â™€ï¸ğŸ™…ğŸ¾â€â™‚ï¸ğŸ“£

Both of these countries have a long record of human rights abuses: China is guilty of genocide against the Uighurs, a Muslim minority. On the construction sites of Qatar's soccer stadiums, at least 6,500 guest workers have died due to inhumane working conditions, as reported by the Guardian.

Today is the #InternationalHumanRightsDay. On this occasion we are calling on EU member states to diplomatically boycott both of these sporting events of international importance. 

"Sport is political. We need a united position at the European level that defends human rights and upholds European values," said our co-president @francescaromana_dantuono . "As a sign of unity and solidarity, Volt demands that no delegation, head of state or other representatives from Europe will travel to these sporting events."
We also encourage athletes to take a stance by personally highlighting human rights issues, like @lewishamilton did in Saudi Arabia.

Do you think that there should be greater gender diversity in EU politics? If we want to change the way politics works, all of our voices, including those of women, should be heard. Volt Europa and its national chapters are dedicated to social equality by engaging everyone in society and politics.

However, currently only 23 percent of Voltâ€™s members are women. This needs to change - and we need you to help us realize that change. In this virtual event, we want to show you what Volt can mean to you as a woman and how you can become a driver for making the EU more inclusive, and hence, more democratic. If you identify as a woman, join us to meet dedicated female Volt members who will share their stories, experiences, and personal motivations on why it is important to be engaged. Above all, we would like to hear your ideas about how politics can become more inclusive and how we can help you become part of this process.

This call for action serves as both a challenge and an opportunity. We challenge you to make your voice heard and to become the catalyst for changing the political status quo. At the same time, Volt will give you the support you need and will offer you the opportunity to not only shape your own and the partyâ€™s future, but also the future of all women across Europe and of generations to come. Letâ€™s make politics a female thing as well! ğŸ™‚

We look forward to connecting with you and to learning from each other!

Op de #COP26 in Glasgow hebben wereldleiders beloofd om ontbossing in 2030 te stoppen. Dat is belangrijk om klimaatverandering tegen te gaan, maar ook voor de biodiversiteit. Wat mij betreft stoppen we ontbossing niet alleen, maar zorgen we ook dat er meer natuur bij komt, en dat we natuurgebieden door heel Europa beter met elkaar gaan verbinden.

Natuur en bos zijn ook gewoon gezond en mooie plekken om te ontspannen. Sinds ik Den Haag woon wandel ik regelmatig op het strand in Scheveningen, of hier in het Haagse bos, naast de Tweede Kamer. Ik hoop echt dat we de beloftes van de #COP26 om gaan zetten in concrete actie, want in 2014 hebben wereldleiders in New York soortgelijke beloftes gedaan, die weinig hebben opgeleverd.Â 

Tijd voor concrete actie! Bijvoorbeeld: door als Europese landen samen te werken om het totale oppervlak aan beschermd natuurgebied in Europa te vergroten van 20% tot 30% in 2030.

Wat goed om te zien dat er vandaag veel mensen aanwezig waren bij de @klimaatmars21 . Ook ik liep mee, en had de kans om weer met zoveel mensen te spreken die zich ook zorgen maken over het klimaat en zich inzetten voor onze toekomst.Â 

De afgelopen week hebben media en politici veel aandacht besteed aan het klimaat, mede wegens de #cop26 in Glasgow. Terecht: Klimaatverandering is een van de grootste uitdagingen waar we op dit moment voor staan. Het is ook hard nodig dat we stappen gaan zetten, want als we doorgaan op de koers die we nu varen, zullen we onze klimaatdoelen niet halen. Â 

De politiek moet dan ook concrete acties ondernemen, gehoor geven aan de roep van alle generaties, en stappen gaan zetten naar een beter klimaatbeleid. Volt wil dat Europa in 2040 klimaatneutraal is. Hiervoor moeten we samenwerken met andere landen, onze CO2-uitstoot verminderen en zo snel mogelijk meer gaan investeren in duurzame energie. Alleen zo kunnen we de huidige, en toekomstige generaties een leefbaar klimaat bieden.

ğŸ—£ What has happened in Kazakhstan and why does it matter?

Earlier this month, Kazakh people took to the streets to protest over the surge of energy prices. 

More than 200 people have been killed and thousands have been injured, about 10,000 people have been arrested.

Everyone must have the right to protest and the EU cannot stand by while human rights are being refused to the citizens of Kazakhstan.

We join the European Parliament in urging Kazakh authorities to immediately release arbitrarily detained activists and we demand a proper and independent investigation into the events. 

We urge the European Commission and the #EU Member States to hold President Tokayew up to the reforms announced on January 11th and use the Enhanced Partnership and Cooperation Agreement (EPCA) with Kazakhstan to promote further democratisation in the country.

Hulp zoeken helpt en dat wil ik je graag op het hart drukken. Ook al voelt het soms zo, je staat er echt niet alleen voor. Erover praten helpt zelfdoding te voorkomen en redt levens.

Tijdens de pandemie zijn we met zijn allen een moeilijke tijd doorgegaan. Voor sommigen zorgde dit ervoor dat alles nÃ³g moeilijker werd. Laten we hier eerlijk over zijn en ons er vooral niet voor schamen.

Fragment van mijn bijdrage aan het coronadebat van gisteren. Ik heb geen trek in feitenvrije politiek. You are entitled to your own opinions, but not to your own facts.

Overigens een kleine rectificatie: ik sprak onbedoeld over steriele vaccinatie. Dat moest steriele immuniteit zijn. Steriele immuniteit heeft te maken met het aantal antistoffen in onze slijmvliezen. Als dat groot genoeg is, kunnen ze het virus onmiddellijk blokkeren en word je dus niet besmet. (Link naar de bron (KULeuven) is te vinden via mijn bio!).

Hele fijne feestdagen lieve mensen!

Dit weekend stond ik in het @financieeledagblad. Rechts NL was op Twitter erg druk met mij. Want ik had gezegd dat Frankrijk een islamofoob land is. Ik maak me oprecht zorgen om Frankrijk. Nooit zal ik terreur goedkeuren. Maar er moet ook ruimte zijn en je af durven te vragen waarom Frankrijk niet goed slaagt in het veiliger maken van Frankrijk. Deskundigen zeggen dat de grote armoede en geen perspectieven in vooral de banlieue een broedplaats zijn. Ik hoop dat Frankrijk in deze verhitte tijden zichzelf herpakt en met een betere aanpak komt. Zodat moslims ook gaan accepteren dat onder vrije woord het beledigen van de profeet erbij hoort. Een gezonde democratie werkt beide kanten op.

65 years ago today, the foundations of the European Union ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º as we know it today were laid out in Rome. 

On this day the Heads of Governments of France, West Germany, Italy, Belgium, the Netherlands and Luxembourg officially agreed to set up the European Economic Community (EEC), by signing the Treaty of Rome. 

In the treaty, the six signatory states declared to:
ğŸŸ£ create a customs union 
ğŸŸ£ create a single market for goods, labour, services, and money across member states
ğŸŸ£ establish some of the institutions we know today: the Council of Ministers, the Commission, the Parliamentary Assembly (that later became the European Parliament) and the Court of Justice.

The treaty of Rome was signed only six years after the establishment of the European Coal and Steel Community (ECSC) in 1951. In the words of Robert Schuman, one of the architects of the European integration project, the ECSC had been designed to make war â€œnot only unthinkable but materially impossibleâ€. Many also hoped it would pave the way for deeper integration between the six countries but when the project of a European Defence Community was rejected by the French National Assembly, governments focused more on economic integration with the plan that political integration would follow.

Despite bumps along the way, we can undoubtedly say that the Treaty of Rome marks the moment when Europeans understood that only by committing to common institutions and values, we would be able to preserve peace and prosperity on the continent. 

And especially today, we have to remember the foresight of the original architects of the European project and respond with unity and ambition to todayâ€™s threats to peace and prosperity.
.
.
.
.

Since 2009, 31 March has been marked as the International Transgender Day of VisibilityğŸ³ï¸â€âš§ï¸ to celebrate trans* people and raise awareness on trans* justice.

â—ï¸Trans* people are still discriminated across Europe and the World in their daily life at work, when they look for a place to live and even when they try to enter the EU.

For example, only 19 EU countries have laws in place protecting trans* people from discrimination in the workplace. And only 14 Member States offer international protection on grounds of gender identity.

Too many people in Europe still feel like they need to hide their true selves and this is just unacceptable. Together, we can build a European society where trans* people can be visible, proud and live their lives to the fullest without fear!

ğŸ“£ Am 21.MÃ¤rz ist der internationale Tag gegen #Rassismus.

Rassismus findet man in allen gesellschaftlichen Strukturen und kann jede Gruppe treffen. Anti-Ziganismus, anti-schwarzen und anti-muslimischen Rassismus kennen wir leider schon lange. Was kann man tun, damit Rassismus sich nicht immer wieder neu befeuert und  weiter verbreitet?

Net als velen van jullie voel ik vandaag veel frustratie: dat Nederland het virus niet onder controle krijgt. Dat het kabinet nu weer met strengere maatregelen komt die de zorgverleners, ondernemers, de cultuursector, studenten, ons allemaal, hard raken. We hadden dit toch kunnen voorkomen?

Ja, ook wij zijn kritisch op het kabinet en we zeggen de afgelopen maanden consequent dat er eerder had moeten worden ingegrepen. Om te voorkomen dat we weer in een situatie kwamen dat alleen de zwaarste maatregelen nog hielpen, mochten de basismaatregelen niet worden losgelaten. Tegelijkertijd zijn er geen eenvoudige oplossingen en wordt de coronacrisis alsmaar complexer. 

Laten we als partijen in de Kamer met alternatieven komen voor het kabinet. Zorg voor versnelling van de boostercampagne: er liggen vaccins op de plank die nu nog niet worden gebruikt. Hier stelde NilÃ¼fer eerder al vragen over aan het kabinet, samen met SP, GroenLinks, JA21, Omtzigt en Den Haan. Tegelijkertijd: vaccineer de wereld en geef de patenten vrij, zodat we nieuwe mutaties geen kans geven. 

Werk ook Europees beter samen. CoÃ¶rdineer reisbeperkingen en zorg dat de Europese Unie grotere voorraden aan medische middelen heeft om lidstaten te helpen die het zelf niet meer redden. 

Het is vreselijk dat kritieke zorg nu wordt uitgesteld. We moeten er alles aan doen om dit virus tegen te gaan. Daar hoort ook een lockdown bij en dat vraagt veel van ons allemaal. ğŸ’œ

Vote Volt in â€œDistrict Europeâ€ in the upcoming March election!

Now Portuguese living across Europe will be allowed to cast their vote again after 157,000 votes were annulled âœŠ

What happened? ğŸ‘€
In the Portuguese parliamentary elections, there are two districts for Portuguese abroad - the District of Europe and the District of Outside Europe. When the votes for these two districts were counted after the elections on 30 January, there was a disagreement over the interpretation of the electoral law! 

The disagreement led to Portugal's second largest party filing a complaint that led to the annulment of 157205 votes from the Europe District. 

The annulled represented 80% of all Portuguese votes in Europe! â€¼ï¸

Deeply frustrated by this attack on democracy, Volt Portugal lodged a complaint with the Portuguese Constitutional Court immediately after the elections. The days between 2022 and the beginning of 2023 have been extremely hot all over Europe.
ğŸ“ˆEight countries broke national records for highest temperatures ever recorded in January.

ğŸŒ¡ï¸Poland reached 19 degrees Celsius. Temperature has exceeded 20 degrees in many European countries, such as in Italy, Belgium and Germany. Some areas of France reached 24 degrees, and Bilbao in Spain even reached 25 degrees!

ğŸ›¢ï¸These temperature records are not a surprise. Rather, they are a consequence of unhalted pollution by corporations and political failure to take serious action on this pollution.

ğŸŒ±Governments cannot continue to ignore what is the biggest threat to our future. The fight against climate change must become priority number 1! We need concrete measures as soon as possible to tackle climate change. We need to focus our forces to realise a real, rapid, and courageous ecological transition.

â„ï¸New Year's Eve in a t-shirt might sound nice, but think of the consequences. If no snow falls in the mountains in Winter, European rivers do not have enough water in Summer, increasing in severity the already common droughts we face in that time of year. Natural rhythms break down, and balance will be impossible to restore.

It is our responsibility to do what we can to stop this trend! Volt is committed across Europe to fight against climate change. Are you?

1 in 5 people in Europe live at risk of poverty or social exclusion. A troubling number that becomes even more horrifying when we talk about people with disabilities: 30% of them face this risk in the #EU.

Many European countries have preferred to raise children with disabilities in â€œspecialâ€ classrooms or schools. However, this method is not only flawed from a pedagogical point of view but it also fosters social exclusion and stigmas around the topic of disability.

ğŸŒLast monthâ€™s COP27 put on display Europeâ€™s hypocrisy when it comes to climate action. 

Read more on our Medium - link in story and bio

ğŸ”¥Despite the Paris Agreement, emissions are only rising. The level of crisis is increasing exponentially â€” natural disasters, weather extremes, food and water insecurity have all become unignorable in the past few years, as they wreak havoc on less developed nations. U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres at the start of the COP27, said: â€œWe are on a highway to climate hell with our foot on the acceleratorâ€. Meanwhile, the level of urgency in our leadersâ€™ actions does not seem to rise with the level of threat. 

We call on our leaders to:

ğŸŒLook less inward and consider the global landscape. The climate crisis will not simply â€œgo awayâ€ by keeping our own house in check. Countries must actively work together and take tangible action on a global scale.

ğŸ’¸Put their money where their mouth is. For example, the loss and damage fund must be funded with cash, and promises for relief funding and adaptation must be kept.

ğŸŒ±Prioritise the energy transition. The EUâ€™s dependency on gas and other fossil fuels needs to end, quickly. 

During the COP27, leaders of developing countries have rightfully called out the climate hypocrisy displayed by developed countries and urged the historic emitters to finally take responsibility for the damage they cause. 

We cannot ignore the urgency of the global fight against climate change. Ignoring this problem will only lead to more environmental degradation, more natural disasters, bigger weather extremes and more human lives lost due to inaction. Africaâ€™s commitment towards the energy transition is critical. If we want them to show up for us, European leaders must show up for them and finally deliver on their promises.

Het kabinet voert ons plan uit: een afkoelperiode voor bewindslieden!

Een Kamermeerderheid hadden we al. Maar na een aangenomen motie moet je goed in de gaten houden of het kabinet er wel mee aan de slag gaat. Dat heeft minister Ollongren nu gedaan: de afkoelperiode komt erâ€¦ zie ook het stuk (op de voorpagina!) van @de_volkskrant van vandaag. We zullen het kabinet nog wel kritisch blijven volgen of en hoe de afkoelperiode gehandhaafd zal worden. 

De Europese anti-corruptiewaakhond GRECO deed in 2019 al de aanbeveling om in Nederland een afkoelperiode in te voeren om zo de politieke integriteit te versterken. Dit draagt bij aan het vertrouwen van burgers in de politiek. Om dezelfde reden willen we ook een lobbyregister dat inzicht geeft in contacten tussen bewindslieden en hoge ambtenaren met lobbyisten. Ook hier hebben we een meerderheid voor gekregen. Wordt vervolgd!

As the dust settles over Putinâ€™s announcement that Russia declares mass mobilization, and four regions in Russian-occupied Ukraine would hold annexation â€referendumsâ€, we at Volt Europa are clear: this is a sign of desperation about a war that Russia can not win.

It is also a reminder that the strategy we have been supporting works: by continuously arming Ukraine, it has driven out Russia from most of Kharkiv Oblast and has begun liberating settlements in the Luhansk and Kherson regions. European politicians must keep up the deliveries, and allow the EU to play a bigger role in coordinating a common European security policy.

Putinâ€™s call for mobilization is not only an escalation on the international stage; it is clearly very unpopular in Russia itself as well, with people taking to the streets and fleeing to the borders. We support these protests and hope that Russian society can finally rise up to put an end to its governmentâ€™s aggression.

ğŸŒ± Minimising the damage humanity causes to the earth's climate is one of Voltâ€™s top political priorities!

It is unfortunate that the goals set and promises made by leaders of previous decades have not materialised. Instead, we are on track to surpass 1,5Â° Celsius of global warming and are still increasing fossil fuel consumption, deforestation, resource exhaustion, and mass consumption. There are positive developments, to be sure - renewable energy is getting more and more funding, reforms are being made, and an understanding of the disastrous situation we are heading towards is dawning on most of mankind.

The most important thing we can do to mitigate climate change is to reduce carbon emissions. As such, Volt proposes: 

ğŸ‘®ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º An EU-wide Carbon Tax to encourage the development of climate-friendly solutions, reduce emissions and fund direct climate mitigation projects. 

ğŸ›¢ï¸ To leave 80% of all known fossil fuel reserves untapped in the ground to limit climate change to a 2Â° warming.

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ”¬ Investing in innovative technologies that will not only help reduce carbon emissions and make the shift to a green economy but also put Europe at the forefront of the green transition.

â™»ï¸ Transitioning to a circular economy, designed to use our resources most efficiently, avoiding waste. Reusing, repairing and recycling all materials will enable new and sustainable ways of economic enterprise. 

Humanityâ€™s relationship with nature has been broken in the past two centuries. It is the task of the current generations to fix this! We can fix this! A healthy climate and even humanity's existence depend on healthy biodiversity. The political climate, too, must change. Europe must work together, everyone contributing their strengths, to ensure we steer away from the ravine we find ourselves at.

Back to school! ğŸ™Œ

Vandaag gaf ik een gastles op de Vinse school in Amsterdam en mocht ik de leerlingen uit de brede brugklas helpen bij hun debat over veiligheid en criminaliteit. We spraken over het belang van inhoudelijke voorbereiding, emotie, respect, voorbeelden en het gebruik van humor, oftewel ingrediÃ«nten om goed te kunnen debatteren. 

De Vinse is school is een bijzondere school! De school is kleinschalig, leerlingen van mavo, havo en vwo zitten er bij elkaar in brede brugklassen, en docenten krijgen er de ruimte om hun eigen onderwijs vorm te geven. Ontzettend leuk om de energie van de middelbare school weer te ervaren. En inspirerend om te zien hoe bevlogen alle leerlingen meededen in het debat.

In het Nederlandse onderwijs moet meer ruimte zijn voor scholen om zelf hun onderwijs vorm te geven. We moeten minder van bovenaf opleggen en meer vertrouwen hebben in docenten en leerlingen zelf. Net als in Finland waar de de Vinse school laat zich door laat inspireren!

#ConferenceOnTheFutureOfEurope: Environmental Education â€“ Education is a force for fostering social mobility and inclusion, as well as the foundation to unite people in a vibrant and dynamic democracy. Education is also a way to encourage and innovate urban development programmes that fulfil specific environmental requirements, intending to make cities greener. Greener cities actively contribute to reducing the impacts of climate change and reducing emissions, such as COâ‚‚ and ozone, which negatively affect citizens' health. Investing in greener cities contributes to the sustainable development of communities which has long-term economic and social benefits. 

Participants of the Conference on the Future of Europe call for minimum standards to ensure buildings and spaces are as green as possible. â€Greenâ€, here, refers to the use of renewable energy sources, reduced energy consumption, low levels of COâ‚‚ emissions and the inclusion of plants in architectural projects. 

A lack of coordination between member states is hindering the effectiveness of existing campaigns and slowing efforts to fight the global challenge that is climate change. Therefore, Volt welcomes the innovative idea of providing training campaigns, disseminated across all available media channels and a new dedicated information portal, in which consistent information is communicated to citizens about the impact of daily actions such as their chosen means of transportation and waste treatment.

Passover - Hope in uncertain times

This Friday, Jews around the world are starting to celebrate Passover, which commemorates the Exodus from Egypt. "From slavery to freedom" is one of the most important concepts that is related to this holiday, which is celebrated with a festive meal together with family and friends.

A global pandemic, a global climate crisis and the ongoing war in Ukraine makes our current outlook seem particularly grim. We don't need to imagine what it must feel like to flee from tyranny, we are very aware of it. Either through our own experiences or those of loved ones, friends, or strangers whose stories have reached our hearts. It is easy to lose hope. But the bitter sweetness of Passover,expressed by some of the dishes on the festive table, Maror ( bitter herbs) and Charoset (sweet date + nut jam), also presents us with another concept: perseverance of hope in uncertain times.
.
.
.
.
#passover #happypassover #passover2022

Italyâ€™s parliamentary elections have signalled a shift to the right not only for Italy itself but also for Europe. An alliance between the â€Brothers of Italyâ€, Lega, and Forza Italia â€“ led by right-wing agitators #Meloni and #Salvini, as well as media magnate, ex-PM, and kingmaker #Berlusconi â€“ has gained 44% of the vote in Europeâ€™s third-largest economy.

Meloni used the slogan â€defend Italyâ€ in her campaign. Her vision for society is illustrated by the following quote: â€Yes to the natural family. No to the LGTB lobbies. Yes to sexual identity. No to gender ideology. â€¦ Yes to the sovereignty of the peoples. No to Brussels bureaucrats.â€ 

Ideologies based on nationalism, racism, and the denial of othersâ€™ freedom and equality, lead only to our darkest selves. We witnessed the damage they can inflict during World War II and see what damage it inflicts today under Putinâ€™s Russia. Italyâ€™s choice to go down this path again, for the first time since Mussolini, is a symptom of people's real fears in todayâ€™s uncertain times. 

The #energy crisis exacerbates the skyrocketing #inflation, and Europe faces a war on its borders on a scale not seen since the 1940s. Climate change is driving more and more #migrants from Africa to Europe, the prospect of which makes people afraid because the current processing of migrants leaves much to be desired. 

This is why Volt believes that, contrary to what the Brothers of Italy pose, more Europe is the answer, not less. The problems of today are too big, too complex, and too borderless to deal with alone.

Italy receives 190 billion euros from Brussels under the European Recovery Plan (the most of any EU country), which its economy needs to modernize and protect people from inflation. Saying â€œno to Brussels bureaucratsâ€ does not increase sovereignty, it simply decreases economic resilience

For everyone convinced that our future is European and wants to actively contribute to a better society: Join Volt! If not you, then who? If not now, when? -> https://www.volteuropa.org/

Mainstreaming Green living is the next challenge. 

This guy has found a way to heat his home for 1000 dkk (133â‚¬) a year, using an oven made from sand and clay, recycled waste water and removing pollution from the ovensmoke to make fertiliser:
" - I have a smoke cleaner where I capture the pollution and turn it into fertiliser," he says, showing how the fertiliser ends up benefiting the lettuce bed."

"- We have a problem called waste water, but you can also see the problem as the solution in the sense that we have water and nutrients that plants want. It provides circulation and we have no discharge," he explains."

" - For me, it's a question of taking responsibility. And systems and rules are not capable of taking responsibility. Rules are just rules, and they stand in the way of us creating the development we need," he says."

Journalists make sure our stories get told and our voices get heard but their work is far from easy and far from receiving the support it deserves.

And with the launch of the invasion of Ukraine, the Kremlin has been hard at work to silence journalists while several countries restricted journalistic work for national security reasons: 
- in Greece, intelligence agencies spied on journalists in the biggest violation of press freedom in the European Union in 2022; 
- in the UK, a national security bill is threatening investigative journalism;
- in Sweden, new legislation is undermining the confidentiality of journalistic sources.

Media freedom is an essential ingredient for a strong democracy and we believe that quality journalism is a public good, not just a commodity.

On #WorldPressFreedomDay and everyday, we support journalists and their fight to unveil the truth.

A fair Europe ends where lack of abortion rights begins.

For the first time in Europe, a pro-choice activist is now on trial in #Poland for having helped a woman get an abortion. If found guilty, Justyna Wydrzyska, a member of the Polish group Aborcyjny Dream Team (ADT), faces up to three years in prison.

Poland currently has one of the strictest abortion laws in Europe and even in cases where it would be legal, NGOs are reporting that medical professionals fear legal repercussions and are unwilling to help women get an abortion.

This is our body, our choice.

We want anyone in Europe to have easy access to safe abortions because we know reproductive rights are fundamental for a personâ€™s freedom, education and career. 

And they should not be under siege, not in Europe nor everywhere else.

This should not happen in Europe.

Yesterday, Polish activist Justyna Wydrzynska was sentenced to eight months of community service for providing abortion pills to people in need. 

With this sentence, Polish courts are setting a very dangerous precedent in Europe for pregnant people and people supporting them.

At Volt, we believe that abortion care is healthcare and any measure against abortions is a measure threatening human rights. We join the European Parliament in urging Member States to include the right to legal and safe abortion in the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union.

All people in Europe should have the same rights and enjoy the same freedoms. The European Union cannot be just a Union on paper, but it must also be a Union of values and rights.

Because it shouldn't matter where you live, you should always have the right to a safe and legal abortion. In Europe and everywhere else across the World.
.
.
.
.

This weekend, our General Assembly will gather Volters from all over Europe together in Prague. It will be the largest Volt event of our short but vibrant history! We will bring a much needed voice to Prague: one that is pro-European, positive and progressive! During our GA we aim to connect citizens across borders, inject new energy into European democracies and find a common voice for the shared interests of citizens across Europe. Why is this so much needed? 

The unjustified brutal war against Ukraine necessitates us standing united with Ukraine on the side of democracy, human rights, and the right of self-determination. Finding a common voice as Europeans is vital, in particular given the current hardship for so many as a result of the war. The energy crisis, the crisis of cost of living are European crises, experienced by people across the EU. And so we will come together this weekend to challenge ourselves to find this common voice across all borders, because we believe that our shared challenges must be answered together. 

Our GA happens against the backdrop of political unrest across Europe. Twice in the last month thousands of Czechs gathered at the iconic Wenceslas Square in Prague to protest against the Czech Republicâ€™s government. Many Czechs are rightfully extremely concerned about the soaring prices of energy and other goods. Alarmingly, the voices in the Czech Republic grow more and more anti-EU. The crises we are battling create a breeding ground for far-right, pro-Russian and other groups and spreads division and anxiety amongst people. 

In these uncertain times, the EU must show leadership and decisiveness. All Member States, let it be Germany with its history of gas dependence or Hungary eroding European solidarity with vetoing important policy measures, must put their own nationalist interests aside for the collective interests of European citizens. Now more than ever we need to stand by each other and protect our values. Our leaders, gathered in Prague today for the informal meeting of the European Council, must realise this. 

#VoltGA

Today's need for a Special Law in Denmark to help Ukrainians demonstrate that we must also abolish the Danish Juridical Opt-out!
Today, the Danish parliament are discussing the Special Law that ensures that Denmark is on a more or less equal footing in the treatment of refugees from Ukraine as the rest of Europe.

This is because the EU has adopted a Temporary Protection Mechanism which gives Ukrainians these rights throughout Europe:
 - residency rights
 - access to the labour market 
 - access to housing
 - social welfare assistance
 - medical or other assistance
 - unaccompanied children and teenagers are entitled to legal guardianship and access to education - 
So why does Denmark need a special law? Because we have a 30-year-old legal reservation that means we don't automatically follow the EU on refugee issues.

Right now, many Danish parties want a humanitarian refugee law in Denmark. 
We could have that right away if we remove the juridical opt-out. 
Because that is what the EU guarantees.

Fortress Europe is not the solution. Fortress Europe is at the core of the problem. Allowing migration to be a positive force should be the aim of European policy on asylum and migration.

ğŸ—ï¸Full reaction to the European Councilâ€™s migration summit on Medium [link in story and bio]

In last weekâ€™s summit in Brussels, EU leaders gathered to discuss the issue of migration. It was clear there that current leaders are putting fundamental human rights aside in favor of holding on to a clearly dysfunctional migration system that, besides being deeply unjust to Southern EU members, fails to protect human dignity and the value of life.

ğŸ§±They pledged substantial funds for surveillance and border security â€œstuffâ€, meaning that EU funds may indirectly end up in costly and useless projects such as fortifying the Turkish-Bulgarian border with fences.

Fact is: walls do not stop migration. Raising more obstacles to entry in the EU will only increase irregular migration along dangerous routes.

The EU must become a union of solidarity, enforcing a minimum threshold of asylum seekers per member state based on member state population, demographics and economic characteristics.

ğŸ‘·Swift inclusion into European societies with easy access to labour markets, education, and political participation is the next challenge.

If the EU really becomes â€œFortress Europeâ€™â€™, it will become a colder, increasingly isolated and culturally, politically, and economically poorer place. It would essentially be less equipped to deal with the multitude of challenges that have already started to manifest â€” let it be the climate crisis or the aging of our societies. Instead of being the source of endless political crises, migration â€” acknowledging its complex human dimensions â€” can be the source of societal enrichment.

Klimaatverandering vraagt om Europese oplossingen. ğŸ’ª 

ğŸ“º Ik vertelde erover bij @denieuwsbv !

Volt Europa entered the European Parliament with the ambition to reform the EU. The reform of the European elections is the first step towards this goal! Below are five reasons why we need this reform:
1. We need true European democracy! Currently, there are 27 national rules determining the outcome of the European elections. There is no European debate, no European accountability, no European democracy! Giving Europeans a truly European vote will be a step towards alleviating the democratic deficit of the EU.
2. Each vote needs to matter! Electoral thresholds exclude the voices of millions of people. Moreover, it goes against the principle of the equality of the vote!
3. Make EU politics younger! Every 18-year-old European can now run for the European elections. This was not the case before! By giving the option to 16-year-olds to vote for younger politicians, European politics will become younger!
4. European politics need to become innovative and competitive. Allowing new political ideas to enter the political debate and decision-making makes politics more diverse and more innovative! 
5. Make voting easy! Make sure that every European citizen, no matter if imprisoned, or far from home, or not there on election day, homeless, or one with a handicap can vote!

#EuropeanParliament, #europeanelections, #EUreform, #europeanunion

Deze week was er interessant klimaatnieuws! TNO test een drijvend zonnesysteem. Het is deÂ  bedoeling dat deze zonnepanelen in de toekomst op zee kunnen worden gelegd, bijvoorbeeld tussen de windmolens. Volgens TNO kan met vijf procent van de Nederlandse Noordzee in de helft van de nationale energiebehoefte worden voorzien. Tijd dat we dit soort innovatieve oplossingen gaan gebruiken!Â 

De komende tien jaar is cruciaal om de ernstigste gevolgen van klimaatverandering tegen te gaan en moeten we harde keuzes maken. It was the best of times, it was the worst of times, it was the age of zoom calls, it was the age of Covid, it was the epoch of EU, it was the epoch of nationalism, it was the season of Light, it was the season of Darkness, it was the summer of hope, it was the winter of lockdown, we had everything before us, we had nothing before us!

While this Holiday season is certainly not comparable to any other, these wise words remind us that we have everything in front of us! We wish everyone to have a relaxing and delightful Christmas, always in small groups! 

Our thoughts go to every person unable to be with family or friends. We also think of all the nurses, doctors and medical staff on call during the holidays. Without you, 2020 would have been even more bleak. 

The holidays can be tough under these circumstances. We do not want to add to the dreary news we have been used to this year, on the contrary we want to make the most of these lines to warm up the heart of those who are starting to lose hope. 
Donâ€™t give up now, because our future is full of hope!

When we will finally get out of the Covid life and we won't be stranded at home, we will have a whole world to recover. We will have to rebuild everything that was damaged or knocked down. Today we might be full of sorrow  but we will be cheerful tomorrow as we are the ones that will revamp the world! 

Although the economic, social, climate predictions are pessimistic; this is our chance to rebuild better, with ambition and powerful ideas. We wish you a brighter future full of hope! 

Happy holidays to everyone!

Volt starts internal HeForShe campaign

#HeForShe is a solidarity campaign originally started by @unwomen to advance #genderequality in our societies. The idea of HeForShe is that fighting the inequality between genders canâ€™t just be the responsibility of the discriminated but has to be driven by men, too. 

Our goal as #Volt Europa is to change our continent for the better. But in order to improve Europe ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º, we constantly have to work on ourselves and embody the change we want to see in our societies. 

And letâ€™s be frank, gender inequality exists almost everywhere and sadly within our organisation, too. For this reason a group of Volters - under the patronage of our co-president @francescaromana_dantuono - found together with the goal to combat this deficit. 

Last Friday was the official launch of the HeForShe campaign within Volt with an event for all Volters, aiming at presenting the initiative and gathering further support. Additional activities and events are already planned in order to create extra awareness for the topic and the initiative and to put in place concrete actions. 

We are aware of the fact that we are just at the beginning of our journey. This is why in our strive for more gender equality, we seek support and help of external partners and experts. 

We will keep you posted on our future endeavours and events.

#sexism #discrimination #UN #women #feminism

2 years in the pandemic, and still not everyone has received their first shot.

According to new UN Development Programme (UNDP) analysis, just about 3% of persons in low-income countries received at least one dose of vaccine, compared to 60 % in high-income ones.

And the overall number of vaccines administered has risen dramatically, but so has the inequality of the distribution: of the more than 10 billion doses given out worldwide, only 1% have been administered in low-income countries. 

Therefore, we urge the EU to set an example by proactively driving vaccine donation programs, especially by increasing its support for the worldwide COVAX immunisation drive, and by quickly lifting any export limitations on vaccine-related products or ingredients.

Tough times require tough decisions. Now, Europe needs to act as a single bloc. Yet the interests of individual countries can block united action. The veto was originally designed to protect minority rights of small member states, but in practice erodes the Union's ability to act for the common good of all Europeans.

For 15 years, the EU has not implemented constitutional reforms. Today, European citizens are clear: abolish the veto and allow the EU to take responsibility for its position in global decision-making. The Conference on the Future of Europe, a democratic innovation, has allowed a randomly selected group of citizens from all over Europe to come up with ideas to change the EU. Getting rid of the veto is one of the 49 ideas they came up with. To answer to what citizens want, to make the EU more democratic, and to enable the EU to act, this out-dated form of decision-making needs to be abolished. 

5 years ago, one of our promises was to abolish the veto. Join us! Sign the petition and open letter, addressed towards the leaders involved in the Conference, advocating for change and a clear follow up. 

Only a united Europe can solve the challenges of the 21st century. 

Get involved: https://noveto.eu/

#NoVeto, #CotFoE  #EuropeanUnion

Het is vandaag de Internationale Dag tegen Corruptie. Daar moeten we bij stilstaan!

De democratische rechtsstaat staat in de EU steeds verder onder druk. Polarisatie in de samenleving neemt toe en het vertrouwen in de overheid neemt af. Overheid en politiek moeten daarom hard werken om het vertrouwen terug te winnen.

De afgelopen maanden hebben we hard gewerkt aan het versterken van de Nederlandse democratie. We werkten onder meer aan een afkoelperiode en lobbyregister. Ik vind het dan ook een eer dat ik gisteren van @youngtinl de Spotlight Award 2021 mocht ontvangen. Dit is een aanmoedigingsprijs om door te gaan met ons werk, en stappen te zetten om de politiek nog transparanter en integerder te maken.

Ik blijf me inzetten voor een eerlijke en transparante overheid en politiek waar iedereen op kan vertrouwen.

Na ruim 270 dagen is er eindelijk een coalitieakkoord. Dit betekent dat we nu echt stappen kunnen gaan zetten om Nederland en Europa verder te brengen. Na de presentatie hebben we het akkoord doorgelezen en gekeken waar we blij mee zijn, maar ook wat beter kan of nog ontbreekt.

Het kabinet heeft mooie woorden over Europese samenwerking en het tegengaan van klimaatverandering, maar veel concrete doelen en echte nieuwe plannen ontbreken. Die gaan wij dan ook aan het kabinet voorstellen! 

Morgen debatteert de Tweede Kamer over de plannen en wijzen we een formateur aan. In januari gaan we verder inhoudelijk in op het akkoord.

Wil je meer weten hoe dit debat gaat en wat wij vinden van het akkoord? Houd dan mijn socials in de gaten, daar zal ik morgen verschillende door jullie ingezonden vragen beantwoorden!

This Holocaust Remembrance Day, we remember all the victims of the Shoa - victims of Antisemitism, hate, prejudice, and racism. We take a long, hard look at our history here in Europe, and at how societies were able to turn upon each other so viciously.

The planned, industrially executed destruction of the European Jewry by Nazi Germany is unique in history - but it hasnâ€™t been the last time we witnessed genocide since. We tend to view that era as though Fascism just happened upon peaceful people and turned them into monsters. Yet, we fail to see that the very same societies that allowed the Shoa to happen, again dabble in anti-democratic rhetoric, ostracize minorities, allow vicious antisemitism and racism of all kinds to spread their venom, and stay silent in the face of heinous atrocities against civilians, such as happened in Bucha, Ukraine - and many other places around the world.

This Yom Hashoa, the Day of Holocaust Remembrance, is another chance for us to turn from apathy to action! 
.
.
.
.
#YomHashoa #ShoaRemembrance #HolocaustRemembrance #NeverAgain
