ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ğŸ‘©â€âš–ï¸ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ”¬ Women make up over half the population, but are still under-represented in politics. The number of female ministers in Denmark has stagnated at 1/3 since 1988. It's time to change this!

ğŸŒğŸŒğŸŒ We need more women in politics! Research shows that more women in politics leads to better politics. Women bring different perspectives and life experiences to the table and contribute to more collaboration and inclusion in politics.

ğŸŒŸ International Women's Day is on Wednesday, so we're dedicating this week to sharing our politics on gender equality and women's rights. But we also want to hear from you! How can we ensure the important task of getting more women active in politics?

Council agreement on asylum system is step in wrong direction

To start off in a positive way, after years of negotiating, the Interior Ministers of all 27 Member States agreed on the Council's position for a new common European asylum system. The agreement was long overdue and left asylum-seekers exposed to incredible horrors.

However, the agreement is a step in the wrong direction! EU ministers want to put #prisoncamps, with watch towers, barbed wires, and video surveillance at the core of the new system. These prison camps are supposed to house kids and families alike, as part of the regular procedure.
On top of that, member states alone determine what safe countries are, and where they can return asylum seekers to.

In addition, countries are allowed to buy their way out of helping each other with relocating asylum-seekers and refugees. Instead, they can buy off their responsibility by transferring 20.000 euros per asylum seeker. All in all, their agreement is a capitulation in the light of pressure from the right, but will not help to control migration flows in Europe and will violate human and children's rights even more.

Read more on Volt Europaâ€™s demands for a fairer asylum system through the link in our bio.

#asylum #humanrights #CEAS

Last Thursday, the Italian Medical Agency (AIFA) postponed its initial April's approval to provide free contraceptive pills for every woman.
While France, Luxembourg and Spain are making some progress, Italy, Malta and Eastern European countries are still facing difficulties to ensure safe access to contraceptives for everyone.

Volt believes in a Europe where everyone can have access to contraception and is free to own their body. We urge Member States to harmonise regulation on access to contraception for everyone in Europe. We need to make information on contraception accessible and sex education classes provided to ensure everyone is aware of how to prevent unwanted pregnancies and sexually transmissible diseases. 

Let's build together a better, fairer and more equitable Europe free of taboos and constraints!

Vandaag is Wereldmilieudag, de dag waarop we in actie komen tegen de vervuiling van ons kostbaarste bezit: de aardeğŸŒ. 

Dit jaar staat in het teken van #BeatPlasticPollution. Rondzwervend plastic is Ã©Ã©n van de grootste ecologische bedreigingen. Wereldwijd belandt ongeveer 20 miljoen ton plastic per jaar in het water. Dat brengt niet alleen ecosystemen in gevaar, maar ook onze eigen gezondheid; microplastics en giftige stoffen uit plastic komen in ons voedsel en drinkwater terecht. 

Daarom willen wij Ã©Ã©n Europees systeem voor statiegeldğŸ¾. De regelgeving voor statiegeld verschilt nu nog per lidstaat. Met Ã©Ã©n systeem kunnen we vervuiling door plastic overal in de ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º terugdringen.

We need a reason to repair, not just a right to repair! 

The world produces 50 million tonnes of electronic waste each year, accounting for 70% of toxic waste in landfills. The EU is stepping up, with the commission putting forward the 2023 â€˜Right to Repairâ€™ proposal. 

We are suggesting going one step further, and implementing three economic incentives, to encourage people to repair their electronic goods: 

1. Reduce tax on labour, but increase it on resources 
2. Repair bonus and tax breaks 
3. A deposit system on appliances

You can read about our suggestions in more detail via the link in our bio!

Ernstige droogte door klimaatverandering vormt in Europa een steeds grotere bedreiging, vooral in het zuiden.

In Spanje vielen al vroeg dit jaar harde klappen: het land ervaarde de warmste en droogste april ooit. Sommige regio's zaten op dat moment al vijf maanden lang (!) zonder regen. Door de lege stuwmeren mislukten oogsten en ontstonden lokaal drinkwatertekorten. 

Alberto Arcos (bestuurslid Volt Spanje) benadrukt dat de gevolgen van de klimaatcrisis alleen met krachtig Europees beleid kunnen worden opgelost. Heute ist in der ganzen Schweiz feministischer Streik.

Der 14. Juni wurde gewÃ¤hlt, weil an diesem Tag in 1981 der Gleichberechtigungsartikel vom Stimmvolk angenommen wurde. Seither gelten MÃ¤nner und Frauen per Gesetz als gleichberechtigt.

Es gibt aber noch Einiges zu tun!
Zu den Hauptforderungen des Streiks gehÃ¶ren Lohngleichheit, Verbesserungen der Renten, Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie, Ausbau der Kinderbetreuung sowie BekÃ¤mpfung sexualisierter Gewalt.
 
Wir setzen uns in ganz Europa fÃ¼r echte Gleichstellung ein. Volt fordert Transparenz zur Lohngleichheit, eine nationale Elternzeit, Ausbau der Teilzeitarbeit und Programme zur FrauenfÃ¶rderung in Politik, Mathematik, IT, Naturwissenschaften und Technik. In der Schweiz und Europa.

=====
Today is a feminist strike all over Switzerland.

14 June was chosen because on this day in 1981 the article on equal rights was adopted by the electorate. Since then, men and women are considered equal by law.

But there is still a lot to do!
The main demands of the strike include equal pay, improvements in pensions, reconciliation of work and family life, expansion of childcare and combating sexualised violence.
 
We are campaigning for real equality across Europe. Volt demands transparency on equal pay, a national parental leave, expansion of part-time work and programmes for the advancement of women in politics, mathematics, IT, science and technology. In Switzerland and Europe.

*event summary policy cafÃ© Merlo* 

This was an event we organised in the framework of the idea gathering phase of the 2024 electoral proces jointly Organised by "@ikbenpro_be " and @voltbelgium.  People of @vista.op.insta were also invited. The event was also open to externals and there was also participation from @agora.brussels
in the event. 

Many thanks to the in total more than 20 participants of the policy idea gathering event. 

First, we did a round of the table where everyone presented themselves and also mentioned 2 to 3 electoral priorities from their perspective. It was not a survey or so but participants could name any topic. We translated everything into 3 languages to be language Inclusive and so we learned to know each other extra well ğŸ˜…

ğŸ¥‡(Sustainable) mobility and public transport was the most frequent mentioned as a top priority topic with 8 to 10 spontaneous mentions in the tour de table. 

ğŸ¥ˆ2nd place of top mentions was for citizen participation and political culture. Those topics had 7 to 8 mentions in the introduction round. 

ğŸ¥‰And at a 3rd shared places economical issues, climate crisis and energy transition with 3 to 4 mentions each in the introduction round. 

Then we started breakout groups. 

â‰ï¸It was without question that we would discuss the two top performers in the introduction round, mobility and public transport on the one hand and citizen participation and political culture on the other hand. 

The mobility and public transport discussion was held in "het Nederlands" while the citizen participation and political culture discussion was held "en FranÃ§ais". A third group discussed digitalization in English.

We have to win the fight to restore nature ğŸ’ªğŸŒ±

While rivers run dry in Spain and towns face torrential flooding in Italy, the quality of our habitats rapidly decreases: 81% is considered in poor status and a third of bee and butterfly species are in decline.

Today the European Parliament is voting on the Nature Restoration law, an ambitious proposal that aims to restore at least 20% of land and sea habitats by 2030. A great step forward, right? Unfortunately, conservatives are trying their hardest to block this law, claiming that it will hurt farmers and bring more food insecurity in Europe.

We canâ€™t let short-term gains get in the way of our plans for a cleaner and safer environment!

Restoring habitats can actually increase the quality of soils, boost human health and mitigate the extreme weather that has been plaguing our crops in recent years.

This means that fighting climate change is not just good for nature: itâ€™s good for our health, itâ€™s good for our economies and itâ€™s good for the wellbeing of future generations.

Together, as Europeans, we still have a fighting chance in restoring our lands and seas ğŸŒŠ

Heute waren wir Ã¼ber 60'000 Menschen, Jung und Alt, die in Bern fÃ¼r Klimaschutz auf die Strasse gingen. Ein Protest gegen den Ausbau 6-spuriger Autobahnen, gegen die VerwÃ¤sserung der ohnehin schon kÃ¼mmerlichen Solarmassnahmen und gegen die Finanzierung fossiler Energien. 
Wir haben mit vielen Leuten spannende GesprÃ¤che gefÃ¼hrt und unsere Positionen an die Menschen herangetragen. Der Klimawandel macht nicht an der Grenze halt und so kÃ¶nnen wir nur zusammen mit Europa der Klimakatastrophe trotzen. 

Today we were over 60,000 people, young and old, who took to the streets in Bern for climate protection. A protest against the expansion of 6-lane motorways, against the watering down of the already puny solar measures and against the financing of fossil energies. 
We had exciting conversations with many people and brought our positions to the people. Climate change does not stop at the border and so we can only defy the climate catastrophe together with Europe. 

Aujourd'hui, nous Ã©tions plus de 60'000 personnes, jeunes et moins jeunes, Ã  descendre dans la rue Ã  Berne pour la protection du climat. Une protestation contre l'extension des autoroutes Ã  six voies, contre la dilution des mesures solaires dÃ©jÃ  misÃ©rables et contre le financement des Ã©nergies fossiles. 
Nous avons eu des discussions passionnantes avec de nombreuses personnes et avons fait connaÃ®tre nos positions aux gens. Le changement climatique ne s'arrÃªte pas aux frontiÃ¨res et ce n'est donc qu'ensemble, avec l'Europe, que nous pourrons faire face Ã  la catastrophe climatique.

Met het sluiten van de TunesiÃ«deal slaat de EU een compleet verkeerde weg in. Een dictator wordt betaald om vluchtelingen weg te houden van de EU. Met steeds meer onmenselijke situaties tot gevolg: afgelopen week werden nog 1200 migranten van TunesiÃ« naar de Libische woestijn gedeporteerd. 

Het is een onmenselijke deal voor een zelf veroorzaakte migratiecrisis. De aanmelding en verdeling van vluchtelingen in Europa verloopt rommelig, en in ons eigen land schiet de opvang zwaar tekort. Het probleem moet bij de wortels worden aangepakt. Hiervoor moet het asielbeleid veranderen.

We want to reduce the number of avoidable diseases such as cancer, heart attacks through incentivising amongst others healthy #food, healthy transportation and reduced smoking. Some of our specific goals include reaching WHO targets on air pollution, green space availability and physical activity. Further, to strongly reduce smoking and reduce levels of #obesity in the population.  And to achieve all this, we focus on positive measures like 0% #VAT on healthy food and investing massively in #rail #infrastructure and active transportation. 

#health  #pollution #volt #pictureoftheday #heartstopper #jointhechange #hospital #cancer #heartattack

Come on in Brussels, April 3th, for our great in person event on Tax Justice.

Next monday, Volt Belgium holds conference at the Free University of Brussels on our Top 3 electoral priority that is Tax Justice. 

In the first part of the event (18u30-20u30) we will hear a presentation from an external tax expert about the UEF resolution on fair taxation, followed by a debate (15 min presentation + 15 min debate). Our main act during the first part of the event is a PANEL DEBATE (45 minutes) on green taxation for companies, green industrial policy, environmental due diligence and Environmental and Social Governance (ESG), all related to companies and entrepreneurship. Participants in the panel will be Diana Andrei, Marie Le Mouel and Bernard Detienne.

After a short break, we will have a series of short pitch presentations outlining Volt Belgium's tax justice electoral policy proposals that the Tax Justice Elections Team has been working on over the last few months based on our preferendum results.

This event is in continuity with our policy-making process. If you are interested in our proposals and want to keep up to date with the latestviews of tax experts, please do not hesitate to make the move. We hope to see you in large numbers !

#taxjustice #votevolt #brussels #voltbelgium #greenpolitics

The EU could have prevented todayâ€™s tragedy off the coast of Kalamata in Greece with a more humane and welcoming migration policy!

@stefanostyros, a member of @voltgreece, was reporting live this morning from the port of Kalamata where the surviving migrants have been given medical attention and shelter. As we share this post, the definitive death toll has risen and it is unclear how many passengers may still be at sea.

Last weekâ€™s decision of the Council of the EU to institutionalise prison-like camps for refugees is a stark reminder that amid unprecedented tragedies, politicians carry on as usual. 

But there is another way: we could prevent deadly tragedies like this one from happening again, if together as Europeans, we raise our voices against inhumane migration policies. 

We do NOT want a Fortress Europe. We need a EU that cares about human rights, a EU where everyone has a fair chance to build a happy and fulfilling life, whoever they are and wherever they come from.

We cannot carry on as usual.

@francescaromana_dantuono 
#NoFortressEurope #HumanRightsMatter #MigrationPolicy #TogetherForChange #RefugeeCrisis #RefugeeRightsAreHumanRights

We are committed to making Europe carbon neutral by 2040. That is 10 years earlier than the EU is currently planning ğŸŒ

To do this, we want to reduce the number of traded CO2 certificates much faster (for the energy nerds: from 2.2 to 8 ppts per year). This shortage makes CO2 emissions significantly more expensive and the biggest CO2 polluters will have to pay heavily ğŸ’¶ 

A third of the money received is transferred directly to the citizens of Europe so that they can afford rising prices ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ‘¦â€ğŸ‘¦

Another third is spent on subsidising green products and investments. This benefits climate-friendly behaviour and peopleâ€™s wallets ğŸŒ±

The last third flows into research and development as well as into the energy infrastructure. This way, we can build a truly pan-European energy grid to ensure green energy across the continent âš¡

We applaud the F-16 coalition between the Netherlands, Greece and Denmark.
This is the essence of "Stronger Together" and hopefully more countries will join.

Ukraine is fighting for our values and in Volt Europa we stand with our Ukrainian sisters and brothers in their fight for freedom and democracy.

During Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's speech in Copenhagen today, the president emphasised that Ukraine defends freedom and democracy against Russian aggression; both core values of our European community.

And values need weapons to defend themselves, especially when faced with a regressive dictatorship that wants to turn the clock back to the dark days of imperialism and oppression.

That was Europe's past, but it will not be Europe's present or future.

Europe must be a beacon of freedom, democracy, peace, prosperity, rule of law and human rights, and all of this needs protection. 
This is just one of the reasons why Volt Europe will establish a common European defence force and a common European defence industry to support it.

Ukraine must win this war because this is not only Ukraine's war, but the war of all Europe and everything we stand for.

(Dutch/Nederlands below) 
We fully support initiatives that provide more night trains to and from Belgium, such as the OBB night train to Vienna and soon the private night train to Berlin. 

We have already made it clear that we want 24/7 trains between the major cities in Belgium, but on top of that we also believe that we should scale up night trains to as many European destinations as possible. 

OBB has about 25 destinations with their nightjet. Belgium should not just passively wait for more night trains, but actively invest in them. 

Volt wants night trains from Brussels to at least 10 European destinations by 2028. 

To which European destinations would you like to see night trains from Brussels?

Volt Leuven lanceert voorzittersduo

Na de oprichting van de Volt afdeling in  Leuven, afgelopen november, hebben de leden op 8 februari jl. Rebecca Baijer verkozen tot medevoorzitter. 
Samen met AndrÃ© Terhorst, die bij de oprichting al was verkozen, zullen zij zich met name richten op deelname aan de lokale, regionale, federale en Europese verkiezingen in mei en oktober 2024.

Door het aanstellen van voorzittersduoâ€™s kiest de partij voor een gebalanceerde leiderschapsstijl waarbij diversiteit en een evenwichtige man/vrouw vertegenwoordiging voorop staan.

Volt is de eerste pan-Europese politieke partij die campagne voert op lokaal, regionaal, nationaal en Europees niveau om de samenwerking in Europa te verbeteren. In een aantal landen, zoals  Duitsland, ItaliÃ«, Nederland en Bulgarije, is Volt al vertegenwoordigd in verschillende politieke organen van gemeenteraad tot Europees parlement.

Speerpunten van Volt zijn o.a. meer burgerparticipatie op alle niveaus, innovatieve economie, sociale gelijkheid en effectievere Europese samenwerking.

Volt streeft er naar burgers te mobiliseren die meer invloed willen uitoefenen op het politieke proces en verkiesbaar te zijn van gemeente tot Europese Unie.

We gaan voor een wereld waarin we gelijk zijn, maar helaas is dat nog altijd niet het geval. Als man krijg je vaak meer kansen dan als vrouw. Er moet nog veel gedaan worden om echte gelijkheid en gelijkwaardigheid te bereiken. Daarom is het belangrijk dat we ons vandaag, op internationale Vrouwendag, uitspreken over wat nog beter kan en moet. News from Volt Netherlands - 

Yesterday, on Volt's 6th anniversary, we were making history. It was on that afternoon that Miranda Meijerman and Dennis Verge were sworn in as Volt representatives for the _Kiescollege niet-ingezetenen_, a new electoral body representing Dutch nationals abroad.
It is the first time that this body is elected, and Volt is with those lucky 25 first-time members!

7.6% of Dutch nationals abroad voted for our Volt candidates. On May 30, they will exercise their mandate and cast their votes for the Dutch Senate.

Also, on this day many other provincial Volt representatives were officially appointed.

Thank you for your trust! We couldn't have done it without the Dutch-Belgian voters and the Volt Belgian support ğŸ™‚

Yesterday, today and tomorrow - we will keep on building for a strong and fair Europe.

Trading clouds for the countryside ğŸŒ„: Jacobâ€™s journey navigating border checks and reviving European rail travel ğŸ›¤ï¸âœ¨

Weâ€™ve heard it before: train travel is the more sustainable option but is it really feasible for long journeys? @jacob.lippold.volteuropa chose the train to come to the #VoltGA in Bucharest and this is the story of his 27-hour journey spanning four countries.

Midnight awakenings for passport control at the Hungarian-Romanian borders felt like a flashback to the 90s â€“ a time of car-bound summer adventures and border crossings. ğŸŒŒ It's baffling that Romania isnâ€™t yet part of the Schengen area, where border checks are a relic.

ğŸš‰ Stress-Free Connections: raise your hand if youâ€™ve ever dreaded the journey to and from the airport! Travelling by train whisks you from city centre to city centre. Arrive at your destination relaxed and ready to explore.

Why does international rail lag behind? ğŸš†âœˆï¸ The allure of speed and budget-friendly flights has kept most travellers sky-bound. Yet, winds of change are whispering as more and more people reshape their journey choices.

ğŸš„ğŸŒ The European Union holds the key to a revitalised rail era. 

Picture this: A high-speed rail web and nightly connections weaving through each member state. Timetables interlocking seamlessly, mandatory transfer communication, and fortified consumer defense. An EU-wide ticketing system knitting together sustainable, affordable journeys for all Europeans.

The key? Collaboration. Only when the EU pushes national railroads to unite, can we uncouple from airplanes and relish the tracks' embrace. Would you take a train instead of a plane for your summer journey? Tell us in the comments!

On Saturday, April 22nd, Volt Belgium will hold its yearly Spring General Assembly in Namur. The General Assembly is a bi-annual event aimed at gathering every member of Volt Belgium to present the advances the party has made over the last few months.

To begin with a broad perspective, the first part of the assembly will be presented by the Policy Team and will be dedicated to reminding attendees of what Volt Belgium, and more broadly, Volt Europa stand for, as well as the resulting policy process. This part will also include a vote on the final texts for  Top 10 Electoral Priorities for the federal and regional elections 2024 earlier chosen by our members in a democratic preferendum. 

The second part of the Assembly will be presented by the Executive Committee and will be focused on the relationship that Volt shares with other parties in Belgium. The third part will be held by the Polca Team, which will present to us the milestones the Party has achieved and the pre-campaign workshop.

Last but not least, workgroups session will be organized in English, Dutch and French. We will have the opportunity to debate together about the policies at issue, to work on our narrative, campaign plans and on city-team building.

The General Assembly will be held at the Faculty of Law of Namur, Auditorium D13, at the Rempart de la Vierge in Namur, from 9:30 AM to 5:30 PM. These meetings only happen twice a year, so we hope to see a lot of you!

Today is International Safe Abortion Day. 

In recent years, Europe has made some progress on extending reproductive rights. The Republic of Ireland amended its constitution in 2018 to permit abortion up to 12 weeks, and the Spanish parliament passed legislation permitting girls aged 16 and 17 to undergo an abortion without parental consent. 

But such gains are fragile. In 2021, abortion in Poland was banned except in cases of sexual violence or if the pregnant personâ€™s life or health are at risk. 

We must ensure the defence of reproductive rights. Specifically, we must: 
Put pressure on national governments to ensure access to abortion 
Support and defend reproductive rights organisations 
Vocally support the right to an abortion

Click the link in our bio to read more about protecting the right to a safe abortion. 
#AbortionRights #AbortionAccess #InternationalSafeAbortionDay

In de grensregio heb je nog dagelijks te maken met de onzichtbare grenzen in Europa. Samen met @romy.frijters en team @voltlimburg ging ik in gesprek met gedreven ondernemers, grenswerkers en betrokken wijkagenten over wonen & werken in de grensregio.

We kunnen nog veel meer doen om werken over grenzen makkelijker en duurzamer te maken. Bijvoorbeeld door moeilijke regelgeving beter over grenzen af te stemmen. Not all those who wander are lost, mobility is part of EU identity!

If you are travelling in Europe, chances are you will be taking a plane if you have no other transport options. Flying is often faster and cheaper than other modes of transportation but the environmental costs are very high!

To meet the #climategoals of the European Green Deal, Europe needs to update its aviation management. For a more climate-conscious aviation sector, we want to:

ğŸ‘‰ Abolish taxation exemptions on aircraft fuel. 

ğŸ‘‰ Increase efforts to achieve net-zero emissions in European international and domestic aviation by 2040 through the aviation advisory council.

ğŸ‘‰ Increase funding for green aviation to go beyond current concepts with limited potential based on evolutionary designs and aim at revolutionary concepts. 

ğŸ‘‰ Push for R&D programs on sustainable aircraft and infrastructure emission reduction.

Senest igÃ¥r pÃ¥ en Frederiksbergsk Facebook-trÃ¥d og i flere andre debatter, er diskussionen centreret om fastholdelsen af lÃ¦rere og pÃ¦dagoger. 

Efter samtaler med reprÃ¦sentanter fra lÃ¦rerstanden og BUPL, med lÃ¦rere og pÃ¦dagoger, sÃ¥ er arbejdsmiljÃ¸, tillid og faglighed ord og Ã¸nsker, der understreges igen og igen. 

Tillid fra sine foresatte og adgang til know-how via efteruddannelse og sparring er kerneelementer i et godt arbejdsmiljÃ¸ og dÃ©t skal vi have fokus pÃ¥! 

Inklusion skal understÃ¸ttes af speciallÃ¦rere med frihed og kapacitet til at kunne leve op til deres faglige stolthed.
Det betyder helt konkret for mig at vi skal sikre basismidler til specielskolerne, sÃ¥ skolerne fortsat kan blive bedre og deres undervisere udvikle sig, selvom antallet af bÃ¸rn stagnerer eller mÃ¥ske falder. 

Derudover skal bÃ¥de pÃ¦dagoger, lÃ¦rere og skoleledere have reel indflydelse pÃ¥ deres hverdag og bureaukratiet skal fordre, ikke forhindre. 

Der er ingen lette eller hurtige lÃ¸sninger, for vi har at gÃ¸re med et kulturskifte.
Med afskaffelsen af nationale tests ser vi en opblÃ¸dning pÃ¥ de kvantitative markÃ¸rer, men der er i stÃ¸rre grad brug for at lade de professionelle undervisere tage teten i de danske folkeskoler.

Derudover Ã¸nsker vi at forÃ¦ldre og lÃ¦rere kan indgÃ¥ i vÃ¦rdifulde partnerskaber til bÃ¸rnenes bedste, med respekt for hinandens kompetencer.

SÃ¥, kort fortalt:
- overordnet fokus pÃ¥ arbejdsmiljÃ¸
- bedre samarbejde og koordinering mellem forÃ¦ldre og undervisere
- mere fokus pÃ¥ faglighed.

ENGLISH version

Work environment must be in focus!

Recently on a Frederiksberg Facebook thread and in several other debates, the retention of teachers and educators has been in focus. 

After conversations with teacher representatives as well as with BUPL, with teachers and educators, work environment, trust and professionalism are the words that are emphasised again and again. 

Trust and access to know-how through in-service training and sparring are key values in a good working environment and this needs to come back in focus. 

Inclusion must be supported by specialist teachers with the freedom and capacity to use their professional capacity to the fullest. 
For me, this means ensuring basic resources are allocated special schools to enable schools to continue to improve and their teachers develop - even if the number of children stagnates or even decreases for a period.

Educators, teachers and school leaders must all have a real say in their daily operations and bureaucracy must drive change, not stall it. 

There are no easy or quick solutions, because we are dealing with a culture change.
However, with the abolition of national tests, we see a softening of quantitative markers, but there is a need to let more of the real professionals take the lead in Danish primary schools.

We want parents and teachers to form valuable partnerships for the good of the children, respecting each other's competences.

So, in a nutshell:
- overall focus on the working environment
- better cooperation and coordination between parents and teachers
- more focus on professionalism.

#GA2021 #Volteuropa #VoltPortugal #volt

In Volt Denmark we are celebrating that the G7 on the 9th of October managed to agree on a minimum corporate tax rate of 15%. 134 countries are expected to follow. Large, international businesses have been able to not pay taxes by using the different rates of different countries, but now we have globally taken an important step against tax inequality. 

In Volt Europa we support a European tax, and therefore we support this global step.

It is important to acknowledge the possibilities that international firms have of bending the global market. And Volt has always been in favour of a FAIR international market.

Many developing economies do in the meanwhile use digital companies, and the possibility of having off-shore companies to establish their own economies. Due to the lack of other resources third world countries have argued that the new minimum corporate tax rate can have serious consequences for those parts of their economies that are built around low corporate taxes. Because of this we should continue to focus on developing FAIR international markets. Something that Volt is already doing with our Globale Balance program!

Jeg hÃ¸rer ofte at politik handler om prioritering - men det handler ogsÃ¥ i hÃ¸j grad om visioner for samfundet.

Jeg Ã¸nsker et stÃ¦rkt sikkerhedsnet for vores bÃ¸rn og deres familier. Det betyder i min optik at man skaber solide rammer for bÃ¸rn med sÃ¦rlige behov OG at det er tilbuddenes kvalitet og bredde, ikke antallet af bÃ¸rn, der skal definere finansieringen. 

ENGLISH 

On Tuesday, I will moderate this debate on inclusion and the need to support children with special needs and their families.

The argument that financing should follow the child makes sense - objectively. But it leaves a question: if smaller cohorts are followed by larger cohorts, are the schools and the system ready to provide the needed support?
And when smaller cohorts of children have more complex diagnoses? 

I often hear that politics is about priorities - but it is also very much about vision for society.

I want there to be a strong safety net for our children and their families and in my view this means creating a robust framework for children with special needs AND that it should be the breadth of provision, not the number of children, that defines funding.

Het is donderdag, dat betekent dat we weer een vraag over de Duitse verkiezingen gaan beantwoorden! De vraag is: wat zijn onze standpunten in Duitsland?

De standpunten van Volt Duitsland lijken in zekere mate op die van Volt Nederland. Als Volt willen wij natuurlijk een soortgelijke boodschap overbrengen door heel Europa. De belangrijkste steekwoorden in het verkiezingsprogramma van Volt Duitsland zijn: Europees, democratisch, actief, klimaatneutraal, ondernemend, digitaal, onafhankelijk, solidariteit en inclusief. Al deze idealen zijn belangrijk voor de progressieve politiek die Volt ook in Duitsland wil doorvoeren.

Volt is active on the #ConferenceontheFutureofEurope! 

We need to change how Europeans vote! 

The way we vote for our European political representatives has not changed since 1979. But in the meantime, Europe has changed. Five new treaties have been agreed upon and 19 new countries have joined the EU since 1979. As a result of this outdated system, there is no single European election. Instead, there are 27 national elections in 27 Member States.

Any citizen movement or political grouping that is able to collect a representative amount of signatures from eligible voters from a quarter of member states of the European Union should be able to run on a common European list and be eligible for elections across all European Union. These should include minimum democratic standards for party and ballot registration to ensure fair and EU-wide comparable access to European politics.

Do you support this proposal? Endorse it and check out all our other proposals using the link in the bio!

If you agree, check out our campaign @ivoteurope !

Volt is active on the #ConferenceontheFutureofEurope! 

Every socio-political group requires a collective story, an imagined community to bind together its citizens in common cause and give it legitimacy. A shared perspective on the past is one of the crucial building blocks of such a dynamic.

Education remains a prerogative of the Member States, but wide gaps exist in both the quality of substance and length devoted to the origins of the foundation of the European Union and its rationales; the catastrophes of the 20th century, with 1945 and 1989 as key dates.

At the same time, heavy politicisation and mythification of historical truth in some Member States has reinforced diverging public perceptions and political narratives through contested historical interpretations.

We want to create a-political the EU and its Member States to create common standards on European History Textbooks in various levels of education across the EU27! Let's plant a tree of community amongst the building blocks of our common past.

Do you support this proposal? Endorse it and check out all our other proposals using the link in the bio!

Volt Nederland har med succes fÃ¥et gennemfÃ¸rt deres korte og konkrete forslag for at standse den evige svingdÃ¸r imellem politik og erhvervsliv.

Ligesom vi ser det i Danmark, sÃ¥ har hollandske politikere alt for hyppigt gÃ¥et direkte fra at regulere en branche til at indtage en ledende rolle i den eller agere som lobbyist. 

For at reducere risikoen for korruption og for at fÃ¸lge GRECOs anbefalinger, har Volt foreslÃ¥et en 2-Ã¥rig afkÃ¸lingsperiode for politikere og det er blevet godkendt med 101 stemmer ud af de 150 i Tweede Kamer.

Volt lÃ¦gger op til et forslag, hvor danske politikere fÃ¸lger eftervederlagsperioden - hvis man har ret til eftervederlag i 36 mÃ¥neder, sÃ¥ er man i karantÃ¦ne i den tilsvarende periode, uanset om man tager brug af vederlaget eller ej.

ENGLISH

Volt Nederland has successfully had their proposal to stop the perpetual revolving door between politics and business approved.

For just as we see it here in Denmark, Dutch politicians have too often gone straight from regulating an industry to taking a leading role in it or acting as a lobbyist. 

To reduce the risk of corruption and to follow GRECO's recommendations, Volt has proposed a 2-year cooling-off period for politicians and it has been approved by 101 votes out of 150 in the Tweede Kamer.

Volt is proposing that Danish politicians follow the currently set renumeration period - if you are entitled to renumeration for 36 months after you leave public office, the cooling-off period will be the sam, regardless of whether one makes use of the remuneration or not.

ENGLISH

Volt supports collective agreements in Europe!

"Also, this Directive does not establish the level of pay, which falls within the contractual freedom of the social partners at national level and within the relevant competence of Member States." (Paragraph 16 of the Minimum Wage Directive)

Therefore, it is sad to see that Danish politicians continue to fight against the opportunity to take a leading role in the development of collective agreements in Europe. 

We in Volt believe that we should share each other's best practices and there are currently only six Member States operating with collective agreements - yet, EU sees collective agreements as the most beneficial in creating equal pay and fair working conditions.

This discrepancy is why Volt wants to change Denmark's attitude towards the EU and promote a real debate about Denmark's future in Europe.

Denne debat sander til fordi der kun er 2 greb: skaf flere mennesker eller reducer skatten for dem, der tjener mest.

Lad os derfor gentÃ¦nke vejen til kompetencer og kapacitet. 
Hvis vi bliver bedre til at dele vores viden, gÃ¸re mere information tilgÃ¦ngeligt for flere, sÃ¥ kan man forestille sig en ny type hÃ¥ndvÃ¦rker, specialautoriserede med en sammensat uddannelse via online trÃ¦ning, afsluttende prÃ¸ver og tilhÃ¸rende certificering gyldigt i mindre perioder. 

For indtil Danmark reviderer vores Visa- og Migrationspolitik, indtil Danmark gÃ¸r det nemmere, ikke svÃ¦rere at vÃ¦re ikke-dansker i landet, sÃ¥ er der ikke flere folk, vi kan stampe op af jorden og fremtidens arbejdsmarked skal vÃ¦re klogere, ikke hÃ¥rdere.

ENGLISH

Time for Micro Training and Certification!

This debate on whether people in construction need to work more hours (and get tax relief) or hire more people, grinds to a halt because those are the only 2 options: get more people or reduce taxes for those who earn the most.

Let's instead rethink the path to skills and capacity. 
If we become better at sharing our knowledge, making more information available to more people, then we might imagine a new type of specialist craftsmen who have compounded their skills via online training, final exams and associated certification valid for shorter periods. 

Because until Denmark revises our Visa and Migration Policy; until Denmark makes it easier, not harder, to be a non-Dane in this country, its hard to see where we can stomp more people out of the ground.
The labor market of the future needs to be smarter, not tougher.

Online training and hands-on certification can boost skills in the job market that reduces pressure and enable smaller jobs to get done quicker.

VaccinetÃ¸ven, "Vaccine hesitancy", skyldes generelt tre faktorer: Selvtilfredshed (nedsat tro pÃ¥ risikoen ved at forblive uvaccineret), bekvemmelighed (er det nemt at blive vaccineret) og tillid (til vaccinens effektivitet, virker de?).

English 

We must take vaccine hesitancy very seriously! 

We need to understand the underlying causes, not ignore them, as a compulsory vaccination drive would.

Vaccine hesitancy is generally caused by three factors: complacency (reduced belief in the risks of remaining unvaccinated), convenience (is it easy to get vaccinated) and confidence (in the effectiveness of the vaccines, do they work?).

The future will bring more pandemics and so we need to insist on building trust in medicine.
Politicisation and polarisation around pandemics can, in the worst case, destroy trust in science and thus our real ability to fight future outbreaks!

Today is the international Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women! ğŸ“…
An estimate of 1ï¸âƒ£ in 3ï¸âƒ£ women in Europe have experienced domestic violence. Research shows that fear, anger, shock and shame are the most common emotional reactions in incidents of violence, and that it causes these women to experience anxiety, difficulties in sleeping, a loss of self confidence and depression.

Violence against women includes physical violence like harassement, assault, rape or murder. But the psychological violence is often invisible to the surroundings and can be just as, or sometimes even more traumatizing. It is important to fight violent behaviour by carrying out more information and awareness, establish safe spaces for the victims and create structures for the social reintegration of victims of abuse.

Europe must stand with Ukraine

The recognition of the separatists regions in Eastern Ukraine by the Russian Federation and the subsequent invasion by Russian troops are an irrefutable and unprecedented breach of international law, of the Minsk Protocol of 2014, of Russiaâ€™s own international commitments, and a declaration of war against Ukraine.

By pursuing this line of action, the Russian government is not only putting the safety and the rights of Ukraineâ€™s citizens at stake but is also harming the interest of Russians citizens. 

The fact that President Putin has referred to Ukraine as â€œa modern construct that is inextricably linked to Russiaâ€ paves the way for a larger scale invasion of the Country. This is why Volt calls on the European Union to answer with unity, strength, and severe sanctioning. 

If the Russian Federation does not retracts its troops, Volt urges the international community to:

sanction Russian banks, companies, military personnel, and other Kremlin-linked individuals, their families, and their business partners;
stop all business deals with the Russian state, Kremlin-associated individuals, and companies; 
freeze all assets of state-owned companies or companies and individuals associated with the Kremlin.
The EU must help strengthen Ukrainian institutions and Ukrainian democracy by supporting its civil society. Furthermore, we demand that the European Union Agency for Asylum coordinates the member statesâ€™ response and the distribution of refugees. 

The Russian actions are a clear signal that Europe must be able to act in unity and defend itself in order to maintain its independence. This requires European Armed Forces. In addition, Volt pleads for a new supranational cyber division, aiming at increasing Europeâ€™s resilience towards cyber and military threats while avoiding violence.

Ukraine has been under constant threat from the Russian Federation since 2014. It seems like the Annexation of Krim, the besiegement of Eastern Ukraine and the constant propaganda warfare have all been a prelude to what is to come next. 

The sovereignty of Ukraine is non-negotiable and we will always stand with our brothers and sisters in Ukraine.

#EU #ukraine #voltswitzerland #VoltEuropa #peace #stayunited #europe #EuropeanUnion

Volt wins case in Portugal's Constitutional Court!
Vote Volt in District Europe in the upcoming March election!
(Dansk nedenfor)

Now Portuguese living in Europe will be allowed to cast their vote again after 157,000 votes were annulled. 
When that happened, the 23-year-old Volter Mateus put his mind to it and in just 8 hours wrote a legal recommendation that laid the groundwork for nearly 200,000 Portuguese residents across Europe to be able to cast their ballots again.

What happened?
In the Portuguese parliamentary elections, there are two districts for Portuguese abroad - the District of Europe and the District of Outside Europe. When the votes for these two districts were counted after the elections on 30 January, there was a disagreement over the interpretation of the electoral law!
The disagreement led to Portugal's second largest party filing a complaint that led to the annulment of 157205 votes from the Europe District. 
The annulled represented 80% of all Portuguese votes in Europe! 

Deeply frustrated by this attack on democracy, Volt Portugal lodged a complaint with the Portuguese Constitutional Court immediately after the elections. You have 24 hours to lodge a complaint, and of the total of 5 parties that lodged a complaint, it was Volt's arguments that secured a new election!

https://visao.sapo.pt/atualidade/2022-02-16-quem-e-mateus-carvalho-o-jovem-que-evitou-a-anulacao-dos-votos-da-europa-e-convenceu-o-tribunal-constitucional-a-repetir-as-eleicoes/

Volt's lead candidate for the District of Europe is Duarte Costa and he is a formidable candidate who will walk through fire and brimstone for a more modern Portugal that thinks innovation and sustainability!

Volt is running for two seats and we hope you will remind your Portuguese friends to vote in District Europe.

Sport is political! We call for a diplomatic boycott of the 2022 Winter Olympics in China and the World Cup in Qatar. ğŸ™…â€â™€ï¸ğŸ™…ğŸ¾â€â™‚ï¸ğŸ“£

Both of these countries have a long record of human rights abuses: China is guilty of genocide against the Uighurs, a Muslim minority. On the construction sites of Qatar's soccer stadiums, at least 6,500 guest workers have died due to inhumane working conditions, as reported by the Guardian.

Today is the International Human Rights Day. On this occasion we are calling on EU member states to diplomatically boycott both of these sporting events of international importance. 

"Sport is political. We need a united position at the European level that defends human rights and upholds European values," said our co-president Francesca Romana d'Antuono. "As a sign of unity and solidarity, Volt demands that no delegation, head of state or other representatives from Europe will travel to these sporting events."
We also encourage athletes to take a stance by personally highlighting human rights issues, like Lewis Hamilton did in Saudi Arabia.

Nun mÃ¼ssen wir als EuropÃ¤er geschlossen zusammenstehen, ein klares Bekenntnis fÃ¼r Frieden abgeben und uns solidarisch hinter die Ukraine stellen.
Wir dÃ¼rfen nicht zulassen, dass mit militÃ¤rischen Mitteln Grenzen zu verschieben eine Option in Europa ist.

â€”â€”-

We strongly condemn the new act of aggression on the part of Russia and the invasion of Ukraine. This is a blatant breach of international law that cannot be justified!
Our thoughts are with the people of Ukraine who are now facing suffering and death because of the Kremlin's imperialist ambitions.
Now we as Europeans must stand united, make a clear commitment to peace and stand in solidarity behind Ukraine.
We must not allow moving borders by military means to be an option in Europe.
We therefore demand strict measures and sanctions against all Russian politicians, military officers, banks, companies, their business partners and people connected to the Kremlin involved in order to force an end to the military escalation. In addition, assets should be frozen and deals with Russian state-owned companies cancelled.
In addition, there is also a need to support Ukraine directly, to provide humanitarian aid and to take in refugees.
Today and in the coming days, we are showing solidarity with Ukraine in cities and towns across Europe and taking part in rallies for peace.
There should never be war in Europe again!
In this context, we also welcome the protests against the war in various Russian cities.

Today we join the rest of Europe in mourning the European Parliament President David Sassoli, who passed away last night in Italy. 

We share our deepest condolences with his family, friends and colleagues and we honour President Sassoli for his work, public service and kindness.

ğŸ—£ What has happened in Kazakhstan and why does it matter?

Earlier this month, Kazakh people took to the streets to protest over the surge of energy prices. 

More than 200 people have been killed, thousands have been injured and about 10,000 people have been arrested.

Everyone must have the right to protest and the EU cannot stand by while human rights are being refused to the citizens of Kazakhstan.

We join the European Parliament in urging Kazakh authorities to immediately release arbitrarily detained activists and we demand a proper and independent investigation into the events. 

We urge the European Commission and the EU Member States to hold President Tokayew up to the reforms announced on January 11th and use the Enhanced Partnership and Cooperation Agreement (EPCA) with Kazakhstan to promote further democratisation in the country.

The recent development at the Russian-Ukrainian border is an unacceptable menace to Ukrainian sovereignty and the freedom of the Ukrainian people. It also represents a direct and substantial challenge to European security and the EU as a peace project.

In order to address those issues, the EU should take a united and proactive stance to safeguard Ukrainian territorial integrity and, above all, the rights of its citizens. 

Nevertheless, the current inadequacy of the EU as a whole to confront external threats to Europeâ€™s security underscores the need for a European Foreign Ministry, a European Defence Ministry and unified European Defence Forces to protect peace and prosperity for all Europeans.

On 15 of May Swiss citizen will be called to vote regarding the increase of Frontex budget, the European Border and Coast Guard Agency, criticised for its operations and activities. As Volt Switzerland we condemn the abuse Frontex was reported to perform, but we support the budget increase.

Funding of Frontex is directly bonded to #Schengen membership, which allows a free movement of people between countries. We donâ€™t want to worsen the relations between Switzerland and the European Union, already at their lowest level. Therefore, we invite the Swiss to vote YES to Frontex budget increase and participation.

ENGLISH VERSION

Why is Denmark not part of the EU Temporary Protection Mechanism? 

Yes, because while the government is negotiating the defence Optout, let's take a look at why we should also remove the judicial Optout.
For why do we need a special law in relation to Ukrainian refugees when the EU has created a pan-European protection mechanism?

Because Denmark's juridical optout means that we are not automatically involved in EU refugee issues. 
Therefore, Denmark gets jewellery laws and MOUs with Rwanda while EU just cooperates to help refugees in need.

Volt wants a fair and pan-European asylum system, reform the Dublin Regulation and genuine solidarity with those forced from their homes by war and natural disasters.

PÃ¥ kvindernes Kampdag deler vi nogle beskeder fra nogle af vores medlemmer pÃ¥ spÃ¸rgsmÃ¥let: hvad betyder dagen for dig? 

"Before I came to Volt, I didn't really care about that day. 
In my social environment, the issue of social justice (for women) was not talked about. 
It was only after hearing and reading all the statements in our groups that there is almost no woman on this planet who does not have to deal with some kind of harassment and discrimination that my understanding changed. 
I realised how easy and largely undisturbed my life is as a white man on this planet.
And that I personally can and must work to eliminate the negative effects that still exist on certain groups in society.

Still, "Happy Women's Day" is hardly something I say. 
Moreover, I find that some people use such commemorative days as an alibi: One message on social media - and you've done your duty for the rest of the year.

I would rather see less "congratulations" and more actual change. In society. And from every single person."

~ Otmar

65 years ago today, the foundations of the European Union ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º as we know it today were laid out in Rome. 

On this day the Heads of Governments of France, West Germany, Italy, Belgium, the Netherlands and Luxembourg officially agreed to set up the European Economic Community (EEC), by signing the Treaty of Rome. 

In the treaty, the six signatory states declared to:
ğŸŸ£ create a customs union 
ğŸŸ£ create a single market for goods, labour, services, and money across member states
ğŸŸ£ establish some of the institutions we know today: the Council of Ministers, the Commission, the Parliamentary Assembly (that later became the European Parliament) and the Court of Justice.

The treaty of Rome was signed only six years after the establishment of the European Coal and Steel Community (ECSC) in 1951. In the words of Robert Schuman, one of the architects of the European integration project, the ECSC had been designed to make war â€œnot only unthinkable but materially impossibleâ€. Many also hoped it would pave the way for deeper integration between the six countries but when the project of a European Defence Community was rejected by the French National Assembly, governments focused more on economic integration with the plan that political integration would follow.

Despite bumps along the way, we can undoubtedly say that the Treaty of Rome marks the moment when Europeans understood that only by committing to common institutions and values, we would be able to preserve peace and prosperity on the continent. 

And especially today, we have to remember the foresight of the original architects of the European project and respond with unity and ambition to todayâ€™s threats to peace and prosperity.

Idag 2. behandler Folketinget sÃ¦rloven, der sikrer at Danmark er nogenlunde pÃ¥ lige fod i behandlingen af flygtninge fra Ukraine som resten af Europa.
EU har nemlig vedtaget en Temporary Protection Mechanism (https://ec.europa.eu/info/strategy/priorities-2019-2024/stronger-europe-world/eu-solidarity-ukraine/eu-assistance-ukraine_en) der giver Ukrainere disse rettigheder i hele Europa:

Hvorfor en sÃ¦rlov i Danmark? Fordi vi har et 30 Ã¥r gammelt retsforbehold, der gÃ¸r at vi ikke automatisk fÃ¸lger trop med EU. 

Der er mange partier, der rÃ¥ber pÃ¥ en humanitÃ¦r flygtningelov. Det kan vi fÃ¥ med det samme, hvis vi fjerner retsforbeholdet. For det sikrer EU nemlig. 

ENGLISH

Today's need for a Special Law in Denmark to help Ukrainians demonstrate that we must also abolish the Danish Juridical Opt-out!

Today, the Danish parliament are discussing the Special Law that ensures that Denmark is on a more or less equal footing in the treatment of refugees from Ukraine as the rest of Europe.

This is because the EU has adopted a Temporary Protection Mechanism (https://ec.europa.eu/info/strategy/priorities-2019-2024/stronger-europe-world/eu-solidarity-ukraine/eu-assistance-ukraine_en) which gives Ukrainians these rights throughout Europe:

 - residency rights
 - access to the labour market 
 - access to housing
 - social welfare assistance
 - medical or other assistance
 - unaccompanied children and teenagers are entitled to legal guardianship and access to education - 

So why does Denmark need a special law? Because we have a 30-year-old legal reservation that means we don't automatically follow the EU on refugee issues.

Right now, many Danish parties are calling for humanitarian refugee laws in Denmark. We could have that immediately if we remove the juridical opt-out. Because that is what the EU guarantees.

On 29 March 2017, as Theresa May launched Article 50 for Britain's exit from the EU, three Europeans launched the first pan-European party.

Recently, Voltâ€™s members in the Amsterdam city council proposed a campaign to preserve energy: Doors closed, lights off! (#zaakgeslotenlichtuit). 

Europe is facing the biggest energy crisis of a century. Everywhere, families are forced to pay double, sometimes triple what they did last year to keep the heat on in their homes. Industries are facing shutdowns that endanger food security, and threaten entire sectors of the economy. 

Meanwhile, big corporate offices and businesses across Europe keep their lights on even when nobody is in the building. This has to stop.

Another factor is climate change. Europe's energy supply is still often reliant on fossil fuels that are driving temperature rise. Every second spent with lights on in places that do not need them, is a second closer to the scenario where this earth will not be liveable for millions of species, and in the worst case: us. 

Voltâ€™s initiative got support from the Amsterdam city councillors, and it is now being explored what judicial powers the municipality has to force business owners to shut their lights off after closing. 

We applaud Volt Amsterdam for this great and necessary measure to conserve energy and plead for other cities, countries, and Europe to follow their example. Together, we can make sure Europe comes out of this crisis stronger, greener, and more resilient! 

#amsterdam, #amsterdamcitycouncil, #energycrisis, #climatecrisis, #saveenergy, #turnoffthelights, #EU, #europe

Education is an investment. Stop the Government's draining of the next generation.
For Volt, education is a cornerstone of our economic vision for Europe and a vital investment in our shared future. 

Harvester. Propulsion reform. Dimensioning. Education cap. These words have characterised the politicians' attitude to education and now the government, led by Lars LÃ¸kke's party, wants to remove half of the Master's programmes in the Humanities and Social Sciences.
They want to remove the possibility to apply for up to 12 additional months of student grant (SU-clips) that you can apply for if you fall ill, have children, change degrees and have to redo some work or do voluntary council work.

Education is an investment in our society and provides us with knowledge and skills that are reflected throughout our lives, not only in the labour market. 

We must therefore ensure that we provide as good a foundation as possible by creating valuable learning environments, from primary school to universities, vocational education and training programmes to ensure the best opportunities for a first-class education regardless of one's preferences.

Volt is in favour of lifelong learning, but not at the expense of education for the young. The next generation faces many challenges and we should equip them, and through them ourselves, as best we can.

Support us today and protect education for the future.

Het kabinet voert ons plan uit: een afkoelperiode voor bewindslieden!

Een Kamermeerderheid hadden we al. Maar na een aangenomen motie moet je goed in de gaten houden of het kabinet er wel mee aan de slag gaat. Dat heeft minister Ollongren nu gedaan: de afkoelperiode komt erâ€¦ zie ook het stuk (op de voorpagina!) van @de_volkskrant van vandaag. We zullen het kabinet nog wel kritisch blijven volgen of en hoe de afkoelperiode gehandhaafd zal worden. 

De Europese anti-corruptiewaakhond GRECO deed in 2019 al de aanbeveling om in Nederland een afkoelperiode in te voeren om zo de politieke integriteit te versterken. Dit draagt bij aan het vertrouwen van burgers in de politiek. Om dezelfde reden willen we ook een lobbyregister dat inzicht geeft in contacten tussen bewindslieden en hoge ambtenaren met lobbyisten. Ook hier hebben we een meerderheid voor gekregen. Wordt vervolgd!

Deze week was er interessant klimaatnieuws! TNO test een drijvend zonnesysteem. Het is deÂ  bedoeling dat deze zonnepanelen in de toekomst op zee kunnen worden gelegd, bijvoorbeeld tussen de windmolens. Volgens TNO kan met vijf procent van de Nederlandse Noordzee in de helft van de nationale energiebehoefte worden voorzien. Tijd dat we dit soort innovatieve oplossingen gaan gebruiken!Â 

De komende tien jaar is cruciaal om de ernstigste gevolgen van klimaatverandering tegen te gaan en moeten we harde keuzes maken. Daarom vroegen wij de staatssecretaris van Klimaat en Energie deze week om in Brussel voet bij stuk te houden: zorg dat aardgasprojecten geen kans meer maken op de miljarden subsidies. Want het is overduidelijk dat we de klimaatdoelen niet halen als we de fossiele industrie blijven subsidiÃ«ren. Laten we deze miljarden vanaf nu investeren in hernieuwbare energiebronnen.

Genoeg te doen dus. Voor nu een fijn weekend voor jullie allemaal!

Topic of the evening: History of Work.

19:30: open discussion

Vi mener at Danmark skal tage konsekvensen af disse udmeldinger og styrke EU. SÃ¥ledes bliver vores europÃ¦iske fÃ¦llesskab en stÃ¦rkere aktÃ¸r, der kan varetage vores nÃ¦rinteresser.

ENGLISH

We have long witnessed America's internal challenges. We've seen voters' desires for more focus on domestic investment and that has influenced American presidents.

Most recently, Donald Trump announced that the US should withdraw from NATO and that sent shockwaves through our security structures, especially those of our fellow Europeans closest to Russia.

We believe that Denmark must take the consequences of these announcements and strengthen the EU. In this way, our European community will become a stronger actor capable of looking after our local interests.

We must not put all our defence eggs in the NATO basket and risk our security at every presidential election.

We must be able to defend ourselves and Denmark must have a voice in that development.

The Climate Crisis, the invasion of Ukraine, and rising hate-driven populist political parties are challenges that go beyond national borders. We as a Pan-European Political Movement, are in a unique position to bring about change. The most effective way that we as a movement can bring about this change is through Election Success in 2024, and in order to be successful, we need a coherent and attractive political narrative.
This General Assembly is organised to define our political priorities so we can tackle the shared cross-border challenges of our time and unite together around a shared programme for the European Elections. Only together can we truly build towards a better future. And only by contributing to this General Assembly can you affect this change.

By removing the juridical opt-out, Denmark can have a fair refugee policy. 

There is notable frustration in Denmark at the different treatment of refugees whether they're from Syria or Ukraine. 
But it is Denmark's juridical opt-out that allows us to assess whether we will follow EU rules on refugees. This should stop!

We believe the best way to ensure a fair refugee policy is to remove the juridical opt-out and we've outlined why on our website ğŸ‘‡

#ConferenceOnTheFutureOfEurope: Protecting our Biodiversity â€” Biodiversity not only refers to the number of species within an ecosystem but also to the genetic diversity within the species' gene pool and the number of and interaction between different communities of species within a larger ecosystem. At the moment, each level is affected by human activity, and in many cases, this interaction results in a reduction in biodiversity. 

The panellists of the Conference on the future of Europe recognized this problem and called for a drastic reduction of chemical pesticides and fertilizers in all types of farming. By enforcing the application of high standards, accelerating the research on natural alternatives and supporting the adoption of new solutions. 

Similarly, Volt calls for a stop to excessive fertilizer use and the associated loss of species. Instead, we should promote initiatives that empower citizens, like urban gardening and sharing economies to reduce waste as well as support and develop enhanced education programs on biodiversity for all generations.

(Picture: https://veeteelt.nl)

Yesterday, Germany celebrated the #reunification that occurred in 1990 between West Germany and East Germany. While reunification was a success, Volt pleads for increased attention to economic differences and points to lessons for Europe as a whole.

People growing up in the two German nations were raised in opposing political, economic, and social circumstances. West was capitalist and democratic, and East was communist and dictatorial. The tensions of the Cold War meant few Germans believed they would live to see their country unite.

But, just as history had separated the Germans, it was the history that brought them back together. The 80s saw a collapse of faith in the communist system. East Germans, demanding change, pursued a peaceful revolution in 1989 that saw the Berlin wall torn down and the #DDR regime collapse. A year later, guided by West German chancellor Helmut Kohl and members of what is today the EU, German reunification became a fact. 

Reunification is a process that is still ongoing today. Privatisation of the planned economy in East Germany led to 3 million lost jobs. Although the economy recovered and grew, economic differences between the regions persist, and people living in the eastern part of the country still feel underrepresented in national politics. In this regard, #Volt pleads for increased dialogue between citizens and politics and strives to bridge the economic gap to allow every citizen to fully benefit from regional and international trade and cooperation

Overall, though, German reunification has been a success. Two countries that at many points seemed close to war, integrated into a democratic and peaceful whole. Germanyâ€™s example inspires Volt to strive for increased European cooperation on all fronts. Let us bridge the economic gaps between the European East and West, caused by the dividing line of the Iron Wall. Let us bridge the political gaps, safeguarding democracy at all costs. Let us most importantly learn how reunification came to be: mutual respect, dialogue, and the acceptance of differences. Together, we can achieve great things. Alone, we achieve only isolation. 

#GermanUnityDay

#ConferenceOnTheFutureOfEurope: Volt wants strong and humane borders - not the FRONTEX kind!

CoFE wants to strengthen FRONTEX to enable it to go to EU border regions as CoFE sees Frontex as safeguarding human rights. However, this is not the case, as the agencyâ€™s mandate is to implement the integrated borders management system. Furthermore, we have also ample evidence that FRONTEX violated EU law and refugeesâ€™ human rights, putting their lives in danger. 

As FRONTEX remains accused of illegal push-back, Volt is sceptical of the CoFE recommendation that it should be awarded more power and independence, though CoFE does recognise the need for full transparency. 

We agree that strong external borders are needed to protect the free movements we achieved within the Schengen area. Nonetheless, this must be done while ensuring orderly and humane access to the EU for those in need of international protection. 
Volt wants to uphold our European values and ensure that the first points of contact with refugees exemplify what the European Union stands for. 

We do not believe this is achieved by granting FRONTEX more powers.

For the first time in Europe, a pro-choice activist is now on trial in #Poland for having helped a woman get an abortion. If found guilty, Justyna Wydrzyska, a member of the Polish group Aborcyjny Dream Team (ADT), faces up to three years in prison.

Poland currently has one of the strictest abortion laws in Europe and even in cases where it would be legal, NGOs are reporting that medical professionals fear legal repercussions and are unwilling to help women get an abortion.

This is our body, our choice.

We want anyone in Europe to have easy access to safe abortions because we know reproductive rights are fundamental for a personâ€™s freedom, education and career. 

And they should not be under siege, not in Europe nor everywhere else.

Last night, Macron and Le Pen met in a debate - but dropping the Defence Opt-Out does not mean we have to do what France says, as some are concerned about.

France is often seen as advocating an EU army, but defence cooperation is intergovernmental. This means that no country can be forced to participate in something it does not want.

Moreover, supranational cooperation requires treaty changes in the EU, and they must be voted on. Even Jeppe Kofod has confirmed this.

However, as it stands, Denmark cannot participate in EU missions and that is bad - both for the EU and for our own military, which is highly respected by our allies. 

The Danish military is well trained and educated, but our opt-out makes more coordinated cooperation with our EU allies impossible. 

That is why we must drop out defense opt-out!

ENGLISH

No. We will not have two separate armies. There is only the Danish defence, just as we have not created a separate Danish NATO army, even here after more than 70 years in the Alliance.

When we invest in our military and we reach the 2% of GDP in relation to our NATO commitments, it covers our European commitments. 

So we should not invest in two different armies for two different organisations - it is the Danish defence that will be made capable of operating both in the EU and in NATO.

At the same time, we must remember that cooperation in European defence remains voluntary. We SHALL not participate in EU missions if we do not want to or cannot,

Fighting for a Europe we can live in â€“ a personal message from Conny Kawohl, Co-Lead Diversity Council at Volt Europa

Far-right forces are moving into parliamentary buildings, turning once proud democracies into autocracies. Fascist rhetoric has taken a hold on public discourse and is being perpetuated without discernment. It seems like we are just following along in their playbook.

I believe that Volt has answers to many of Europe's biggest issues. I believe that we are a strong, diverse set of pan-European voices who unite under the same idea of a united Europe with strong liberal, democratic values and an inclusive mindset.

But we need to be careful - our European ideals don't always translate well outside of our bubble. This fuzzy warm feeling that we get when we talk about Europe isn't something everyone in Europe has experienced, or will ever experience for that matter. It is one of a privileged elite. We need to recognise that there are very hard-hitting issues for people in Europe today that we still fail to adequately name. The fear of poverty and homelessness, the deep-seated anxiety around our climate emergency and the impact it has and will continue to have on our lives. Additionally, experiences of discrimination based on gender, sexuality, age, ability, faith, ethnicity or status are just shrugged off as marginal.

Let us use the energy that exists within our movement and increase our solidarity, be visible on the streets and inspire others to join us. Let's set a clear signal that we stand against fascism, and on the side of a diverse Europe of many voices and lived experiences. Let's build networks of care with organisations near and far, and listen to their experiences and best practices.

And letâ€™s become active allies and supporters - you don't need to have a disability to speak up for accessibility, and you don't need to be Jewish to support the Jewish community. Everyone can support indigenous and people of colour to finally be heard and point out white privilege and racism. You don't need to be a woman to be a feminist!

Join Volt and letâ€™s turn our frustrations and fears into a force for good: https://volt.team/join

The initiative Expedition Grundeinkommen wants to start a basic income experiment in #Berlin and is campaigning for a corresponding referendum. Right now, their volunteers are collecting signatures in the city's streets, parks and everywhere else. The local Volt team Volt Berlin with its co-president Oskar Saemann is helping them.

If seven percent of all eligible voters in Berlin support the idea with their signature on paper (digital isn't possible), a referendum will be held. This referendum is basically like an election with a ballot paper on the subject and people can vote Yes or No.

To be on the safe side, the initiative wants to collect 240.000 signatures. The deadline is the 6th of September. As of now, the number amounts to around 61.000. So it's going to be tough but still possible.

This should not happen in Europe.

Yesterday, Polish activist Justyna Wydrzynska was sentenced to eight months of community service for providing abortion pills to people in need. 

With this sentence, Polish courts are setting a very dangerous precedent in Europe for pregnant people and people supporting them.

At Volt, we believe that abortion care is healthcare and any measure against abortions is a measure threatening human rights. We join the European Parliament in urging Member States to include the right to legal and safe abortion in the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union.

All people in Europe should have the same rights and enjoy the same freedoms. The European Union cannot be just a Union on paper, but it must also be a Union of values and rights.

Because it shouldn't matter where you live, you should always have the right to a safe and legal abortion. In Europe and everywhere else across the World.

#JakJustyna Volt Polska

#ConferenceOnTheFutureOfEurope: Although the EU has been built on economic foundations, there has been a growing interest over the last decade in the role that culture can play within the EU. 

Cultural programmes and exchanges are recognized as having a unifying effect, promoting diversity by encouraging decentralized initiatives; the processes of decentralization and democratization undertaken in certain countries; and raising citizens' awareness of development issues. 

The CoFE has focused on one specific objective regarding cultural exchanges: access and democratization of existing European programmes. In the report, the EU recognizes its responsibility to â€initiate, mediate, and fund cultural and social exchanges across the continentâ€. Indeed, the EU has set up several programs over the past decades to support job creation in culture (Europe Creative), regional development, education and vocational training (Erasmus+), and new information technologies (Horizon Europe). 

However, the EU notes that these are unfortunately not yet available to everyone and â€allows only a small percentage of European citizens to participateâ€. Therefore, a democratization initiative is taken into account to facilitate access to these opportunities for all citizens, of any age, level of education and financial capacity. The benefits of cultural exchange have been promoted by Volt from the beginning: to create a more connected, inclusive, federal and democratic Europe that encourages the active participation of citizens at every level. 

Volt recognizes that this is essential for mutual respect and understanding, to equally represent the interest of citizens. Therefore, this is the Volt program: 
- Volt supports a significant increase in EU exchange programs and links around the world to strengthen global cooperation and mutual understanding and promote a people-centred approach to globalization. 
- Youth programmes, such as Erasmus+, and collaboration with organizations and individuals from third world countries in the completion of the Horizon 2020 research framework program should be continued, streamlined and expanded to include more participants from third world countries.
- Promote intercultural exchanges, with workshops and visits to religious sites, and more practical educational tools.
- Develop school programs that better integrate diversity, for example through intercultural exchanges, and internal Erasmus opportunities in different regions of the country to reduce regional differences.
- Introduce a one-year, paid, voluntary "civic scholarship" that allows young people to support the state in a variety of tasks, from traditional administrative jobs to military and social services. Combine this scholarship with geographic mobility programs to encourage European exchanges.
- Call for increased EU funding for transnational cultural cooperation in Europe. EU funding for culture, through the Erasmus+ program, supports programmes that allow Europeans to study, train, gain experience, and volunteer abroad, thereby contributing to exchanges between Europeans and fostering the emergence of a common European identity. Funding for the audiovisual, cultural and creative sectors is provided through the Creative Europe program.

Op de #COP26 in Glasgow hebben wereldleiders beloofd om ontbossing in 2030 te stoppen. Dat is belangrijk om klimaatverandering tegen te gaan, maar ook voor de biodiversiteit. Wat mij betreft stoppen we ontbossing niet alleen, maar zorgen we ook dat er meer natuur bij komt, en dat we natuurgebieden door heel Europa beter met elkaar gaan verbinden.

Natuur en bos zijn ook gewoon gezond en mooie plekken om te ontspannen. Sinds ik Den Haag woon wandel ik regelmatig op het strand in Scheveningen, of hier in het Haagse bos, naast de Tweede Kamer. Ik hoop echt dat we de beloftes van de #COP26 om gaan zetten in concrete actie, want in 2014 hebben wereldleiders in New York soortgelijke beloftes gedaan, die weinig hebben opgeleverd.Â 

Tijd voor concrete actie! Bijvoorbeeld: door als Europese landen samen te werken om het totale oppervlak aan beschermd natuurgebied in Europa te vergroten van 20% tot 30% in 2030.

ENGLISH 

Volt will strengthen internationalisation!
English language education strengthens our knowledge base and the future needs more, not less, knowledge and exchange!

We face technological, demographic and societal challenges and it is irresponsible not to use every opportunity to address them.

English language education enables talented researchers and educators to bring their knowledge to students in Denmark.

Furthermore, it is clear that our challenges require cross-border cooperation and we strengthen the potential for international relations when more people have studied, lived and worked in Denmark.

And let's stop using SU loans as a reason to limit internationalisation.
SU is used in the local economy - students pay rent, buy food, insurance and internet. If we want to reduce the need for SU and SU loans, we should address the shortage of student housing. 

And finally, SU loans from European students could be recovered if Denmark removed the juridical Optout.

Volt is in favour of education, exchange and development! For too long we have been told that we must make ourselves smaller, that we are under threat, that we must close ourselves off.
That is a wrong vision for Denmark and that is why Volt wants to stand for elections so we can expand our potential and solve our real challenges!

2 years in the pandemic, and still not everyone has received their first shot.

According to new UN Development Programme (UNDP) analysis, just about 3% of persons in low-income countries received at least one dose of vaccine, compared to 60 % in high-income ones.

And the overall number of vaccines administered has risen dramatically, but so has the inequality of the distribution: of the more than 10 billion doses given out worldwide, only 1% have been administered in low-income countries. 

On #WorldHealthDay, we urge the EU to set an example by proactively driving vaccine donation programs, especially by increasing its support for the worldwide COVAX immunisation drive, and by quickly lifting any export limitations on vaccine-related products or ingredients.

#LearnMoreAboutVolt:

Hoe vet zou het zijn als je je elektrische auto kan opladen in de tijd dat je een dieselauto vol zou tanken? En hoe mooi is het als de technologie die daarvoor nodig is dan ook nog bedacht is door studenten?

Naast inzetten op OV en fietsen kunnen elektrische autoâ€™s een belangrijke rol spelen in de energietransitie. We willen dat bedrijven de ruimte krijgen om te innoveren, want door innovatie kunnen we obstakels in de verduurzaming wegnemen: door bijvoorbeeld de oplaadtijd van elektrische autoâ€™s te verkorten zodat meer mensen voor duurzaam vervoer kiezen.

Woensdag was ik op bezoek bij InMotion, en hun doel is om dat al binnen een paar jaar mogelijk te maken. In 2023 moet het opladen van je auto nog maar vier minuten duren.

Wat ook mooi is: studenten spelen hier een actieve rol in. Zij denken met InMotion mee over deze nieuwe technologie. Sommigen van hen nemen verlof van hun studie om er een jaar te komen werken. Het bedrijf onderhoudt daarna contact met deze studenten, zodat ze kunnen blijven meedenken over de doorontwikkeling van de technologie.

When is enough going to really be enough?

We all remember all too well when the body of 2-year-old Alan Kurdi washed up on the shores of Turkey in 2015. EU governments vouched then to â€œnever againâ€ let this happen and promised to come up with a well-functioning European system that has solidarity at its heart. 

Fast forward 8 years and this painful history continues to repeat itself on the Bulgarian border and off the coast of Italy. These are not standalone incidents, they are the consequence of a migration policy that focuses more on building bigger barriers and forcing asylum seekers to take dangerous routes to get to Europe. 

The only solution is a structural solution: we need to ensure that search and rescue efforts are effective, solidarity mechanisms are in place, and legal migration routes are provided. 

Read more about how we can make #migration safer, supportive and more effective - https://www.volteuropa.org/statement/EU_Member_States_choice_to_turn_back_time_on_asylum_leads_to_more_deaths_in_the_Mediterranean
