Volt takes the view that bringing women into politics (and keeping them there) requires a broad approach to womenâ€™s societal roles in general. Necessary steps include:

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ«Mentoring and training: Supporting women working in sectors in which they are underrepresented (such as politics)
ğŸš¼Access to childcare: Providing high-quality, affordable support
ğŸ“œRatification of the Istanbul Convention: Ending persistent discrimination and violence against women and minorities

Jessica Ardern, New Zealandâ€™s female ex-PM, is an inspiration to Volt. The lessons we can learn from her are plenty, but the main one is this: WE NEED MORE WOMEN IN POLITICS!

For Volt Europa Co-President, Francesca Romana Dâ€™Antuono, Ardernâ€™s empathic leadership style represented â€˜a new way of doing politics: more humane and caring, but not weak; the kind of leadership we need to meet the challenges of our modern times.â€™

The reality is that women remain very much in a minority in all political spheres. Across the EU, just over 30 per cent of MPs of national governments are women. 

Volt makes a point of ensuring gender-balance within its own internal structures. According to its statutes, the Board of Volt must be gender-balanced, while each formal position in the European team must be shared between a male/non-binary and female/non-binary Volt member.

â€˜How can we believe that we are going to build a resilient and thriving society without the perspective of half of the population?â€™, asks Francesca Romana Dâ€™Antuono.

By showing the world that there is a different way of doing politics, Jacinda Ardern allowed politically-active women to feel legitimised in a sphere that remains, sadly, hostile to them. Now that she has made her exit (at least for the time being), it is up to us to ensure that we take her example. If we do not, we will continue to approach the worldâ€™s problems underprepared and under-resourced, without the knowledge, insights and perspectives of half the worldâ€™s people.

NL and FR below

On Saturday, April 22nd, Volt Belgium will hold its yearly Spring General Assembly in Namur. The General Assembly is a bi-annual event aimed at gathering every member of Volt Belgium to present the advances the party has made over the last few months.

To begin with a broad perspective, the first part of the assembly will be presented by the Policy Team and will be dedicated to reminding attendees of what Volt Belgium, and more broadly, Volt Europa stand for, as well as the resulting policy process. This part will also include a vote on the final texts for  Top 10 Electoral Priorities for the federal and regional elections 2024 earlier chosen by our members in a democratic preferendum. 

The second part of the Assembly will be presented by the Executive Committee and will be focused on the relationship that Volt shares with other parties in Belgium. The third part will be held by the Polca Team, which will present to us the milestones the Party has achieved and the pre-campaign workshop.

Last but not least, workgroups session will be organized in English, Dutch and French. We will have the opportunity to debate together about the policies at issue, to work on our narrative, campaign plans and on city-team building.

The General Assembly will be held at the Faculty of Law of Namur, Auditorium D13, at the Rempart de la Vierge in Namur, from 9:30 AM to 5:30 PM. These meetings only happen twice a year, so we hope to see a lot of you!

Let's unite Europe together! ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º

Neederlands :

Op zaterdag 22 april organiseert Volt Belgium haar Algemene Vergadering in Namen. Dit tweejaarlijkse evenement brengt alle leden van Volt samen en presenteert de voortgang die de partij heeft geboekt in de afgelopen maanden.

Het eerste deel van de vergadering, gepresenteerd door het beleidsteam, zal beginnen met een een presentatie over de kernwaarden van Volt, en een overzicht van de beleidsprocedures. Daarnaast zal er gestemd worden over de finale teksten van onze Top 10 Verkiezingsprioriteiten die de leden eerder hebben gekozen in een democratisch preferendum. 

Het tweede deel van de Algemene Vergadering zal worden gepresenteerd door het bestuur en zal zich richten op de relatie die Volt heeft met andere partijen in BelgiÃ«. Het derde deel zal worden georgansieerd door het campagneteam. 

Na afloop van deze presentaties zullen er werkgroepsessies worden georganiseerd in het Engels, Nederlands en Frans. Hier krijgen leden de kans om te debatteren over beleid, te werken aan onze verhaallijn, campagneplannen en teamopbouw in de steden.

De Algemene Vergadering vindt plaats op zaterdag 22 april in de Faculteit der Rechtsgeleerdheid van Namen, Auditorium D13, aan de Rempart de la Vierge. Het evenement begint om 9.30 uur en eindigt om 17.30 uur. Aangezien deze bijeenkomsten slechts twee keer per jaar plaatsvinden, hopen wij veel van jullie te verwelkomen!

In Europe, only 6 countries use collective agreements - the rest use politically determined minimum wage levels. 
In 2022, the EU adopted a directive setting collective agreements as the gold standard in the EU - so why is the Danish government against it?

Collective agreements provide good working conditions and create transparency and fairness in wage negotiations. We have a European labour market and working conditions must be fair and just throughout Europe.

Volt har en vision for fremtidens arbejdsmarked og det krÃ¦ver reform pÃ¥ EU-plan.

Vores medlem af Europa-Parlamentet, Damian Boeselager, er hovedforhandler pÃ¥ et nyt direktiv, der skal gÃ¸re Europa mere attraktivt for talenter og gÃ¸re det lettere for indvandrere at planlÃ¦gge! Direktivet hedder direktivet om fastboende udlÃ¦ndinge!

ENGLISH

Volt has a vision for the future of work and this needs reform at EU level.

Our MEP, Damian Boeselager, is the lead negotiator on a new Directive to make Europe more attractive for talent and making it easier for migrants to Europe to plan for the long term! The directive is called the Long-Term Resident Directive!

By working on this directive, Volt is working towards better rights for migrants throughout the EU, building retention and creating new and better opportunities for legal migration.

The question is: Will Denmark be part of such a development?

Denmark's juridical opt-out prevents us from being part of the EU's Blue Card scheme, which gives visas to qualified workers from 3rd countries, i.e. countries outside the EU or EEA.

Volt sees this as a problem when the business community in Denmark is crying out for skilled labour. 

Volt is working for a better labour market and that requires reform of our working hours, our working conditions AND it requires that we reform the way we retain international employees and workers.

So support our fight for a more open labour market, where Denmark does not lag behind the rest of Europe.

When will Bubatz become legal? ğŸ¥¦ This is a question many people in Germany have asked and after 16 years of conservative stalemate on German drug policy, the government is going ahead with making it legal for adults to grow and buy a certain amount of cannabis. But why is legalisation taking so long in Germany? Because this is in fact another issue that concerns the entire EU! ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º

In fact, cannabis is also regulated under European law and more specifically in:

ğŸ‘‰ Schengen Implementing Convention
Within the Schengen area, border controls no longer take place, which also means that drugs can cross the respective national borders uncontrolled. EU Member States are therefore obliged 
to take measures to prevent illicit trafficking of narcotics. 

ğŸ‘‰ European Criminal Law
Each Member State must take the necessary measures to ensure that the offering, offering for sale, distribution, sale and supply of drugs are punishable. 

â¡ï¸So what happens now? A war on drugs has not and will not work. We believe we should stop looking at this and other issues through a national lens and start discussing them using a European approach. In this light, what is happening in Germany is a good step forward and we hope it will lead to a broader discussion across EU countries on decriminalising drug possession below a certain amount.

â“What is your position on this issue? Would you have thought that national drug policies are linked to EU law?

Council agreement on asylum system is step in wrong direction

To start off in a positive way, after years of negotiating, the Interior Ministers of all 27 Member States agreed on the Council's position for a new common European asylum system. The agreement was long overdue and left asylum-seekers exposed to incredible horrors.

However, the agreement is a step in the wrong direction! EU ministers want to put prison camps, with watch towers, barbed wires, and video surveillance at the core of the new system. These prison camps are supposed to house kids and families alike, as part of the regular procedure.
On top of that, member states alone determine what safe countries are, and where they can return asylum seekers to.

In addition, countries are allowed to buy their way out of helping each other with relocating asylum-seekers and refugees. Instead, they can buy off their responsibility by transferring 20.000 euros per asylum seeker. All in all, their agreement is a capitulation in the light of pressure from the right, but will not help to control migration flows in Europe and will violate human and children's rights even more.

Read more on Volt Europaâ€™s demands for a fairer asylum system here: https://www.volteuropa.org/opinion/20230609-asylum-agreement

Vandaag, op #Wereldwaterdag, staan we stil bij het belang van schoon water voor gezondheid en welvaart. Watermanagement is onze trots, maar ons oppervlaktewater is van slechte kwaliteit en de drinkwatervoorziening staat onder druk. 

Vrijwel nergens in Nederland scoort het oppervlaktewater 'goed' volgens de Europese norm - we zijn met recht de slechtste van de Europese klas. Vanaf 2027 moeten onze wateren aan deze norm voldoen. Net als bij de stikstofcrisis schuiven we een goede aanpak voor waterkwaliteit al jaren voor ons uit. 

Ons drinkwater is wÃ©l van hoge kwaliteit, maar wordt door de opwarmende aarde steeds schaarser. Zelfs in ons â€˜natteâ€™ Nederland wordt de levering van drinkwater onzekerder door toenemende droogte en verzilting. Daarom moeten we alles op alles zetten om onze klimaatdoelen te halen en ons richten op het vasthouden van water, in plaats van het direct af te voeren.

The debate on pension reform in #France has clearly shown that a systemic reform taking into account all challenges of todayâ€™s society is much needed.

Issues like #ClimateChange, our ageing population, migration, the digital transition or inequality are all interconnected and should be factored in any forward-thinking pension reform. 

Increased heatwaves and storms could worsen life expectancy rates, the ageing population will leave France in need of almost 4 million workers by 2050, technology advancements will revolutionise the workplace in ways we have yet to discover and finally, inequalities in the pension system do not provide a good solution to people with long or interrupted careers.

At Volt, we believe that the EU can help us overcome the short-term vision that too often characterises national politics. We therefore propose to launch a consultation for a systemic reform of the pension system in France that will bring together French, European and Non-#EU citizens alongside with professional organisations.

The challenges we face today have no borders. Only together, we can build a pension system that is sustainable, fair and offers individualised management of retirements in France. 

Read more - https://buff.ly/3K8gr9C 

#pensionreform #reformedesretraites

We welcome the arrest warrant issued by the International Criminal Court (ICC) against Putin, even if it is  mainly a symbolic gesture! 

Still, this remains an important signal in the fight against war crimes and breaches of international law worldwide. However, in supporting it, Europe must clearly demonstrate that we are not merely using the ICC as a "political tool" to pursue our interests. 

We must not forget that many families and relatives of the victims of the wars in Syria, Afghanistan and Iraq are still hoping in vain for justice: international law only works if we apply it to all and unfortunately, there are still many countries, such as China, USA, Russia, and more that are not partners of the Rome Statutes establishing the ICC. 

This clearly shows that national, European and international institutions must be reformed in the long run to to be able to effectively prosecute and punish war crimes, while remaining independent from political spheres of influence. 

Together, we can create a new Common European Foreign and Security Policy and make Europe fairer for everyone!

We have to win the fight to restore nature ğŸ’ªğŸŒ±

While rivers run dry in Spain and towns face torrential flooding in Italy, the quality of our habitats rapidly decreases: 81% is considered in poor status and a third of bee and butterfly species are in decline.

Today the European Parliament is voting on the Nature Restoration law, an ambitious proposal that aims to restore at least 20% of land and sea habitats by 2030. A great step forward, right? Unfortunately, conservatives are trying their hardest to block this law, claiming that it will hurt farmers and bring more food insecurity in Europe.

We canâ€™t let short-term gains get in the way of our plans for a cleaner and safer environment!

Restoring habitats can actually increase the quality of soils, boost human health and mitigate the extreme weather that has been plaguing our crops in recent years.

This means that fighting climate change is not just good for nature: itâ€™s good for our health, itâ€™s good for our economies and itâ€™s good for the wellbeing of future generations.

Together, as Europeans, we still have a fighting chance in restoring our lands and seas ğŸŒŠ

Last Thursday, the Italian Medical Agency (AIFA) postponed its initial April's approval to provide free contraceptive pills for every woman.
While France, Luxembourg and Spain are making some progress, Italy, Malta and Eastern European countries are still facing difficulties to ensure safe access to contraceptives for everyone.
Volt believes in a Europe where everyone can have access to contraception and is free to own their body. We urge Member States to harmonise regulation on access to contraception for everyone in Europe. We need to make information on contraception accessible and sex education classes provided to ensure everyone is aware of how to prevent unwanted pregnancies and sexually transmissible diseases. 

Let's build together a better, fairer and more equitable Europe free of taboos and constraints!

We have to win the fight to restore nature ğŸ’ªğŸŒ±

While rivers run dry in Spain and towns face torrential flooding in Italy, the quality of our habitats rapidly decreases: 81% is considered in poor status and a third of bee and butterfly species are in decline.

Today the European Parliament is voting on the Nature Restoration law, an ambitious proposal that aims to restore at least 20% of land and sea habitats by 2030. A great step forward, right? Unfortunately, conservatives are trying their hardest to block this law, claiming that it will hurt farmers and bring more food insecurity in Europe.

We canâ€™t let short-term gains get in the way of our plans for a cleaner and safer environment!

Restoring habitats can actually increase the quality of soils, boost human health and mitigate the extreme weather that has been plaguing our crops in recent years.

This means that fighting climate change is not just good for nature: itâ€™s good for our health, itâ€™s good for our economies and itâ€™s good for the wellbeing of future generations.

Together, as Europeans, we still have a fighting chance in restoring our lands and seas ğŸŒŠ

Why are women still underrepresented in politics? 

According to the UN, it will be another 130 years before women are equally represented in the highest positions of power, and just over 30% of MPs in EU national governments are women. 

Female politicians face more online abuse than their male counterparts, with one report finding that during the 2020 US presidential campaign, tweets about female candidates were more likely to be abusive than those aimed at their male counterparts. 

Thereâ€™s lots we can do to close the gender gap in politics: quotas, legislation combating cyber-violence, anti-harassment training, and better political education in schools. 

Find out more about why we are still seeing a lack of women in politics: https://buff.ly/453OlEM 

#womeninpolitics #EU #genderequality

Happy April 25th! 
Today, we celebrate an important day for liberty and democracy in both Italy and Portugal. In Italy, we honour Liberation Day, marking the end of the country's nazifascism occupation during World War II. In Portugal, we commemorate the anniversary of the Carnation Revolution, a peaceful coup that ended the dictatorship and paved the way for democracy.

On this day, we remember the sacrifices of thousands of people, soldiers and partisans, who fought and gave their lives for freedom and rights. We also reflect on the importance of the European ideal and democracy in securing and preserving our freedoms and values.

But today we cannot only look critically at the past, we must also look with determination at the present and the future. The fight against fascism and totalitarianism are never over. Fascist ideas are still alive and dangerous in our society, and still threaten the fundamental values of humanity. We cannot afford to be indifferent to these threats.

As we celebrate April 25th, let us come together to continue the fight for a more just and democratic Europe. Together, we can build a brighter future for all and safeguard our cherished democratic principles! Join Volt - https://buff.ly/3897FcB 

#April25th #LiberationDay #CarnationRevolution #Italy #Portugal #Liberty #Democracy #JoinVoltEuropa #VoltEuropa #25Aprile

The debate on pension reform in #France has clearly shown that a systemic reform taking into account all challenges of todayâ€™s society is much needed.

Issues like #ClimateChange, our ageing population, migration, the digital transition or inequality are all interconnected and should be factored in any forward-thinking pension reform. 

Increased heatwaves and storms could worsen life expectancy rates, the ageing population will leave France in need of almost 4 million workers by 2050, technology advancements will revolutionise the workplace in ways we have yet to discover and finally, inequalities in the pension system do not provide a good solution to people with long or interrupted careers.

At Volt, we believe that the EU can help us overcome the short-term vision that too often characterises national politics. We therefore propose to launch a consultation for a systemic reform of the pension system in France that will bring together French, European and Non-#EU citizens alongside with professional organisations.

The challenges we face today have no borders. Only together, we can build a pension system that is sustainable, fair and offers individualised management of retirements in France. 

Read more - https://buff.ly/3K8gr9C 

#pensionreform #reformedesretraites

Today is International Safe Abortion Day. 

In recent years, Europe has made some progress on extending reproductive rights. The Republic of Ireland amended its constitution in 2018 to permit abortion up to 12 weeks, and the Spanish parliament passed legislation permitting girls aged 16 and 17 to undergo an abortion without parental consent. 

But such gains are fragile. In 2021, abortion in Poland was banned except in cases of sexual violence or if the pregnant personâ€™s life or health are at risk. 

We must ensure the defence of reproductive rights. Specifically, we must: 
1. Put pressure on national governments to ensure access to abortion 
2. Support and defend reproductive rights organisations 
3. Vocally support the right to an abortion

Click the link to read more about protecting the right to a safe abortion https://buff.ly/3PUxyjj 
#AbortionRights #AbortionAccess #InternationalSafeAbortionDay

Journalists make sure our stories get told and our voices get heard but their work is far from easy and far from receiving the support it deserves.

And with the launch of the invasion of Ukraine, the Kremlin has been hard at work to silence journalists while several countries restricted journalistic work for national security reasons: 
- in Greece, intelligence agencies spied on journalists in the biggest violation of press freedom in the European Union in 2022; 
- in the UK, a national security bill is threatening investigative journalism;
- in Sweden, new legislation is undermining the confidentiality of journalistic sources.

Media freedom is an essential ingredient for a strong democracy and we believe that quality journalism is a public good, not just a commodity.

On #WorldPressFreedomDay and everyday, we support journalists and their fight to unveil the truth.

Trading clouds for the countryside ğŸŒ„: Jacobâ€™s journey navigating border checks and reviving European rail travel ğŸ›¤ï¸âœ¨

Weâ€™ve heard it before: train travel is the more sustainable option but does it really work for long journeys? Jacob Lippold chose the train to come to the #VoltGA in Bucharest and this is the story of his 27-hour journey spanning four countries.

Midnight awakenings for passport control at the Hungarian-Romanian borders felt like a flashback to the 90s â€“ a time of car-bound summer adventures and border crossings. ğŸŒŒ It's baffling that Romania isnâ€™t yet part of the Schengen area, where border checks are a relic.

ğŸš‰ Stress-Free Connections: raise your hand if youâ€™ve ever dreaded the journey to and from the airport! Travelling by train whisks you from city centre to city centre. Arrive at your destination relaxed and ready to explore.

Why does international rail lag behind? ğŸš†âœˆï¸ The allure of speed and budget-friendly flights has kept most travellers sky-bound. Yet, winds of change are whispering as more and more people reshape their journey choices.

ğŸš„ğŸŒ The European Union holds the key to a revitalised rail era. 

Picture this: A high-speed rail web and nightly connections weaving through each member state. Timetables interlocking seamlessly, mandatory transfer communication, and fortified consumer defense. An EU-wide ticketing system knitting together sustainable, affordable journeys for all Europeans.

The key? Collaboration. Only when the EU pushes national railroads to unite, can we uncouple from airplanes and relish the tracks' embrace. 

Would you take a train instead of a plane for your summer journey? Tell us in the comments! 

#RediscoverRail #SustainableTravel

Mensenhandel beschouwen als alleen een strafrechtelijke kwestie is niet genoeg. Het gaat ook en vooral om slachtoffers. Daarnaar moeten we onze aandacht verleggen. Naar preventie en herstel van slachtoffers. Laten we een effectieve strategie ontwikkelen om mensenhandel zowel lokaal als wereldwijd te bestrijden. 

Nu is het perfecte moment om in actie te komen! De EU herziet haar richtlijn inzake mensenhandel, wat de mogelijkheid biedt om een gedurfdere en humanere aanpak te volgen. Samen kunnen we het verschil maken!

Bij Volt geloven we heilig in een mensenrechtengerichte strategie. Met gezondheidszorg en bescherming voor alle slachtoffers.
Met verblijfsvergunningen voor slachtoffers in het buitenland.
Met erkenning van (de ervaringen van) vrouwelijke slachtoffers. Laten we die slachtoffers eindelijk centraal stellen!

Heute ist in der ganzen Schweiz feministischer Streik.

Der 14. Juni wurde gewÃ¤hlt, weil an diesem Tag in 1981 der Gleichberechtigungsartikel vom Stimmvolk angenommen wurde. Seither gelten MÃ¤nner und Frauen per Gesetz als gleichberechtigt.

Es gibt aber noch Einiges zu tun!
Zu den Hauptforderungen des Streiks gehÃ¶ren Lohngleichheit, Verbesserungen der Renten, Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie, Ausbau der Kinderbetreuung sowie BekÃ¤mpfung sexualisierter Gewalt.
 
Wir setzen uns in ganz Europa fÃ¼r echte Gleichstellung ein. Volt fordert Transparenz zur Lohngleichheit, eine nationale Elternzeit, Ausbau der Teilzeitarbeit und Programme zur FrauenfÃ¶rderung in Politik, Mathematik, IT, Naturwissenschaften und Technik. In der Schweiz und Europa.

=====
Today is a feminist strike all over Switzerland.

14 June was chosen because on this day in 1981 the article on equal rights was adopted by the electorate. Since then, men and women are considered equal by law.

But there is still a lot to do!
The main demands of the strike include equal pay, improvements in pensions, reconciliation of work and family life, expansion of childcare and combating sexualised violence.
 
We are campaigning for real equality across Europe. Volt demands transparency on equal pay, a national parental leave, expansion of part-time work and programmes for the advancement of women in politics, mathematics, IT, science and technology. In Switzerland and Europe.

Vi bifalder F-16-koalitionen mellem Holland, GrÃ¦kenland og Danmark.
Dette er essensen af ordsproget "Stronger Together" og forhÃ¥bentlig vil flere lande slutte sig til.

Under den ukrainske prÃ¦sident Volodymyr Zelenskyys tale i KÃ¸benhavn i dag understregede prÃ¦sidenten, at Ukraine forsvarer frihed og demokrati mod russisk aggression; begge kernevÃ¦rdier i vores europÃ¦iske fÃ¦llesskab.

Og vÃ¦rdier har brug for vÃ¥ben til at forsvare sig selv, isÃ¦r nÃ¥r overfor et regressivt diktatur, der vil skrue tiden tilbage til mÃ¸rke dage med imperialisme og undertrykkelse.

Det var Europas fortid, men det vil ikke vÃ¦re Europas nutid eller fremtid.

Europa skal vÃ¦re et fyrtÃ¥rn for frihed, demokrati, fred, velstand, retsstatsprincipper og menneskerettigheder og alt dette har brug for beskyttelse. 
Det er bare Ã©n af grundene til, at Volt Europa vil etablere en fÃ¦lles europÃ¦isk forsvarsstyrke og en fÃ¦lles europÃ¦isk forsvarsindustri til at understÃ¸tte den.

I dette Ã¸jeblik kÃ¦mper Ukraine den gode kamp for vores vÃ¦rdier, og i Volt Europa stÃ¥r vi sammen med vores ukrainske sÃ¸stre og brÃ¸dre i deres kamp for frihed og demokrati.

Ukraine mÃ¥ vinde denne krig for dette er ikke kun Ukraines krig, men hele Europas krig og alt, hvad vi stÃ¥r for.

ENGLISH

We applaud the F-16 coalition between the Netherlands, Greece and Denmark.
This is the essence of "Stronger Together" and hopefully more countries will join.

During Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's speech in Copenhagen today, the president emphasised that Ukraine defends freedom and democracy against Russian aggression; both core values of our European community.

And values need weapons to defend themselves, especially when faced with a regressive dictatorship that wants to turn the clock back to the dark days of imperialism and oppression.

That was Europe's past, but it will not be Europe's present or future.

Europe must be a beacon of freedom, democracy, peace, prosperity, rule of law and human rights, and all of this needs protection. 
This is just one of the reasons why Volt Europe will establish a common European defence force and a common European defence industry to support it.

At this moment, Ukraine is fighting the good fight for our values, and in Volt Europe we stand with our Ukrainian sisters and brothers in their fight for freedom and democracy.

Ukraine must win this war because this is not only Ukraine's war, but the war of all Europe and everything we stand for.

ğŸš¨Our current approach to human trafficking isn't cutting it, and it's time for a change!

Did you know that more than 1.3 million people are trapped in modern slavery in the EU, and a staggering 71% of trafficking victims are women? This is a major issue that requires urgent attention.

Framing trafficking solely as a criminal justice matter isn't working. We need to shift our focus towards prevention and the rehabilitation of victims. 

The EU is currently reviewing its Directive on human trafficking, which presents a golden opportunity to adopt a bolder, more humane approach. At Volt, we firmly believe in a human rights-centred strategy that includes:

ğŸ¤ Providing healthcare and protection to victims without the need for legal cooperation
ğŸ›‚ Granting residence permits to victims identified in countries other than their own
ğŸšº Recognising that victims have different experiences, with women making up 71% of those trafficked, often for sexual exploitation.

Let's shift the focus to the victims, not the perpetrators.
Together, we can build a Europe that stands up for its people and respects their rights ğŸ™Œ https://buff.ly/3OaQMPy

ENGLISH

A life of dignity includes a dignified death.
Everyone's life has value and it is the joy of life that makes death worth talking about.

The Ethical Council's decision is based on fear, not the wishes of citizens when they write: "If we offer euthanasia, it is said, directly or indirectly, that some lives are not worth living." (The Ethical Council's statement on euthanasia (2023), p. 8)

The Ethical Council also believes that proper regulation in this area is not possible.

Specifically, Volt believes that as part of assisted euthanasia, a register should be set up for doctors who believe that assisted euthanasia is in accordance with their own ethical convictions. 

We also need to have an informed conversation on the subject so that we can once and for all remove the fear that some consider life to be worth less and instead empower individuals to make the decisions that are best for them.

Death is part of life, and when assisted suicide is rejected on the grounds that there is a lack of better debate on the topic, let's have a debate!

Because it is not responsible that today you can travel to Switzerland or the Netherlands, but not die with dignity in your home country.

Read our policies: www.voltdanmark.org/en/euthanasia
